He wasn't there because of a business trip, but he still kept in touch and made sure we were doing alright. There was another couple staying in a different room, and it was very nice to see them every now and then. They were very friendly and kind. The room and apartment were very clean and well kept. It felt like a very comfortable hotel! We highly recommend this room to anyone. It was a perfect experience and couldn't have asked for anything better!

We had a great time in New York and we loved staying at Patrick's apartment.  It was in a GREAT location.  Quiet, safe and very close to the subway.  It was also nice being across the street from Central Park.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable.  Patrick was a great host; friendly, easy going, and knows New York very well.  We felt lucky to find such a great place in such a good location and with such a gracious host.  Hope to return in the fall.  Love New York.

We had a perfect journey in New York. The appartement of Patrick was very clean, and very peaceful. The subway is right on the corner and so it is very easy to get everywhere you want. the neighbourhood is very quiet, and that is very nice, to be a bit " out of " the madness of this beautifull town. Patrick was not so much at home during our stay, but when he was there he was very helpfull and gave us good and practical tips/recommendations. If we were in trouble ( it was not the case ... ) we could always reach him by text or phone. REally we had the time of our life. The bed was good, and the bathroom was very clean. It was a bit small, but good enough to stay with two people. And we could chill in the living room, making breakfast etc ... I should certainly return there.

The more I'm using the air bnb site to make my travel arrangements,the more its getting comfortable and makes travel a breeze.i share my most recent experience at Patrick's place right next to the lungs of NYC.Patrick was a great host-very warm and friendly,prompt in his communications earlier on while making the (Website hidden by Airbnb) apartment was clean and the room in which I stayed is ideal for 1-2 persons.there's a kitchen in there but why would you use it when there are a million eating joints all over NYC.
Patrick's directions to the apartment were pinpoint and even to a novice like me found them easy to follow.
The subway on 103rd street is close by and travelling anywhere is so easy.you don't have to stay close to the conference venues as I found out.the metro is super efficient.
The location is adjacent to upper west Central Park- calm and serene.
Overall I highly recommend this place and it was a pleasure 
to have Patrick Soluri as my host.

Patrick was an excellent host and the location was perfect for our interests and needs. The room is compact and the bathroom small but adequate. I do not hesitate to recommend this place to stay and we will happily return if we can.

We are really satisfied with Patrcik hospitality. Everythng went well during our stay. The appartment is well located close to metro and is confortable. 

Some details to consider before choosing Patrick´s apartment

a) It´s on 4th floor. If you have many with luggages take care
b) It´s not an objection but there are many doves outside the building. During the night, they can be noisily

We recommend Patrick´s house for Airbnb users.

My husband and my 2 year old son spent almost 2 weeks at Patrick's place and had a really good time. The photos and description on the website are very honest...what you see is what you get! The place is clean, the bedroom has enough space, the bed is very comfortable and you can get a good night rest away from the very busy midtown and downtown. The apartment is just in front of beautiful Central Park (with loads of play grounds) and very close to the subway that takes you everywhere in no time. We highly recommend it.
Great place, great host, great books, very comfortable, convenient and at ease. Thanks so much!

My wife and I had a fantastic time.  Patrick is an excellent host and the entire trip went smoothly.  From the information provided in advance, to the ease of check in, to the friendly chats during our stay, to the perfect location, to the facilties and cleanliness of the apartment, to the flexibility of check out, the whole trip was perfect.

The location of the apartment provides easy access to Central Park and the nearby subway stop.  The area is quiet and safe and plenty of shops and food outlets nearby.

I would highly recommend staying with Patrick while in New York and my wife and I are already planning our trip next year!

A wonderful host and a great location on Central Park and near a subway station. Patrick waited until we arrived from the airport at around midnight to assist us with our luggage up the stairs and to welcome us to his apartment. Those with bad knees or a lot of luggage take note there are a lot of steps! This is a 4th floor walk-up. Our bedroom was compact with an en-suite. The apartment is clean and well kept. Although we chose not to cook during our stay, we had this option and everything was readily available for us. We went every where by subway which is easy to negotiate. I recommend this listing to anyone who is visiting New York. Thank you Patrick!

Meme si nous ne nous sommes pas rencontrés, tout a été très simple pour trouver l'appart, recuperer les clés et communiquer avec Patrick. L'appart est idéalement situé. Nous vous le conseillons.
Charlene

Although I didn't actually get to meet Patrick, he was very responsive and conscientious in his communications.  Very nice apartment - spacious with zero clutter.  Everything was there to prepare a nice breakfast and used the french press to make coffee.  Overall, great experience.

Unfortunately, staying at Patrick's apartment was a total nightmare, unlike everybody else's review. Although I am definitely not a clean freak, his place was not clean by our basic standard. It was even a health hazard. READ ON... TO THE END!!! The toilet in the room with private bathroom was flushing when it felt like it (50% of the time). We were advised by Patrick to use the other toilet, which was also flushing half the time! A plumber was called only days later. There was a huge hole in the ceiling above the bathtub in the room. I was afraid of what would fall from it while showering. The walls, door knobs and fixtures in the bedroom (and everywhere) were very dirty. After being advised by airbnb to talk with Patrick about cleanliness, he said this was not a hotel! But, Patrick did somehow clean the room a bit after telling us only if we were out of the apartment! The stove was not functioning very well. He told us about the stove right away after we arrived, but did nothing about fixing it until 2 or 3 days later. Cooking on the stove was out. We were in NY during a heat wave, and because the air conditioning machines were on at the same time, the power went out for a while, so we were in the dark! The second night we were there, we saw mice in the kitchen and lots of unsafe droppings. Patrick replied to my messages after a while and came home to clean. That is when he told us he had caught a mouse in his kitchen a few days prior to our arrival!!! He did call the exterminator, but we did not feel like eating there anymore, or continue to stay there for that matter. We were on edge the entire time because we had no other place to stay. We wasted 4 days looking for another place to stay, and of course, all the other places we had in mind were no longer available! Plus, the first night we arrived in the building, we saw cockroaches in the stairway. I asked Patrick right away about cockroaches and he told us there were none in his apartment, but ... we did see them in the living room but he denied it being a cockroach. We saw another one in the room we rented, we caught in on camera. We left right away. Airbnb was responsive, thank you. We provided them with all the pictures and videos to prove all these. The other concerns I have is with the location of his apartment. Despite what he told me, it is NOT a safe area for a woman, nor for teenager (my son was with me). We were afraid to walk after dark. Even during the day, the area is quite sketchy! Patrick, although I am sure you are a nice person, we are unable to recommend your apartment to anyone.0 star...

Patrick was very helpful and hospitable, and the apartment was quite comfortable with a great location. We slept very well and despite not being 5 star (and doesn't pretend to be !), it is great value if you spend most of the day exploring and just need a place to recover. Had great Thai food and heard a great band at the Jazz Club, both nearby. We met very nice people during our stay at Patrick's. I would not hesitate to recommend it to travellers.

Hola, he disfrutado mucho la estancia en el apartamento de Patrick. Es acogedor, limpio, bien situado y Patrick es una persona encantadora dispuesta a ayudarte con información de la ciudad y actividades. Me gustó mucho el barrio y está bien comunicado. Lo recomiendo a todo el mundo.
Hello, I really enjoyed staying at the apartment of Patrick. It is cozy, clean, well located and Patrick is a lovely person willing to help with city information and activities. I liked the neighborhood and is well connected. I recommend it to everyone.

Just come back from New York! We!ce spent 4 days at Patrick's flat. What a beautiful flat! Patrick is really a nice guy!
Thank you for everything!

The apartment is in a great location with a very short walk to the nearest subway station. Patrick wasn't around, but we had no problems at all in organising and during our stay. The room itself is relatively small, but the space is used well, with plenty of storage and a very convenient en-suite! Overall a great base for exploring New York City!
Very handsome and good located apartment.

Wir haben sehr schöne Tage in New York verbracht. Das Zimmer ist für einen Trip super gelegen, der Central Park direkt gegenüber und die U-Bahn um die Ecke. Patrick selbst war unterwegs, wir konnten ihn leider nicht kennenlernen. Er war aber trotzdem sehr zuverlässig und für unsere Fragen jederzeit erreichbar, das war super!

Great place, especially for the price! Right across from Central Park and close to two Subway entrances which was very convenient. 

The room and bathroom are small, but functional. Everything you could need was included. Access to the kitchen and refrigerator was nice also as it helped save some money on breakfast items and quick lunches. 

Patrick was very nice, and very respectful of your privacy. I would definitely recommend this to someone on a budget.

Patrick is a great host, and has a very convenient and clean place in a cool part of town - the Upper West Side.  One thing, however - since this is a 4 story walk-up with no elevator it is not suitable for people who have difficulty climbing stairs.  A garage is right next door for you to store your car if you are on a road trip, and it is very close to Central Park and the B / C subway lines.

Patrick's apartment is in a convenient location close to Central Park and the Subway. It's in an old building, so there's issues with drainage (to be expected) but Patrick has a nicely renovated (though not new) apartment which is clean and tidy. Our room was small but the bed was comfortable and it's nice to have a private bathroom with nice towels etc. A previous guest had damaged the air-conditioner so the room was stuffy but Patrick provided a fan which helped enormously. We were able to use Patrick's kitchen facilities for eat-in breakfasts which was great. Patrick was very helpful and gave us some great travel tips. Thanks, Patrick.
Great location, nice neighborhood, makes you fell like going back home after a day in NYC. Patrick was very toughtful and answered our requests very quickly. Highly recommend this place!

I would not hesitate to stay at Patrick's apartment again.  It was clean.  It was quiet and peaceful at night...I wasn't around during the day.  The subway is less than three blocks away.  Central Park is literally across the street..  Patrick is very accommodating.

We loved our stay in New York and Patrick's hospitality was stellar, and the room was perfect for us.  Convenient to everything, safe, neat and clean.  Any questions we had, Patrick was quick to answer and gave us great ideas for theater tickets, etc.  Will stay again when we come back for sure.  Danni Breen and Richard Shaw

Patrick is an excellent host.  All of the logistics are communicated clearly.  The location of the apartment is great with several subway stations nearby.  There were also very convenient options for grocery options and drugstores.  The neighborhood felt very safe, and the proximity to Central Park is very appealing.

The room is small but adequate.  The private bath is very clean and functional. 

I didn't see much of Patrick, but he was very kind and helpful when I first arrived.

The apartment is in a great location next to Central Park.  The subway is very close by, making it easy to get around the city.  There is a Whole Foods just a few blocks away. Patrick provides a shelf in the fridge and space in the cabinet for guests to store food. The bedroom is exactly as described and Patrick is very helpful and friendly.  He even helped us carry our suitcases.

Fantastic location with easy access to subway lines and good amenities in the neighborhood.  We loved being right on Central Park and felt very safe walking it day and night.  The bedroom is small, but the bed is very comfortable and the bathroom has a tub/shower.  Patrick is a gracious, thoughtful, interesting host with a lifetime of knowledge about NYC!

We had a wonderful week in new York and a nice stay with Patrick, finding out many common interests. Musicians and Lindy Hoppers wellcome!! :-)  The house is situated right at central Park, through which you can walk to the museums or towards Midtown. Even though B/C line didn't stop at night at the very close subway station (96th street), the 1,2,3 lines were not far away, as well as restaurants and shops. We had a very nice stay!
Highly recommend!  Great location; only 3 blocks from the subway.  Patrick is a great host.
great host!  clean room/bathroom.  very responsive, friendly.  thank you patrick!

Great place! Great Host!
Patrick was very nice and accommodating, and the room with attached bathroom was perfect for our needs. The place is right across the street from the westside of mid-central park & we were close to several awesome sights and museums, and the subways is right on the corner.

We just returned from our fantastic trip to NYC.  Our stay at Patrick's definitely enhanced our experience.  His great location, proximity to subway heading down into Manhattan, Central Park, museums, etc.  Patrick was very helpful and had several great recommendations for us.  We highly recommend using his affordable apartment as a base for visiting NYC!!!

Patrick's accomodations made for a great home base during our recent stay in NY city.  We came and went on our own schedule, and found Patrick to be a very accomodating person. His home is clean and welcoming with close access to the  B and  C subway line -- within 3-4 blocks. Particularly nice was the private bathroom adjoining our bedroom. Small and  clean, the accommodations matched our needs perfectly, and Patrick couldn't have been a nicer person.

Probably the best host I ever had while traveling! Room was awesome, extremely clean! Patrick was very friendly and even invited me out to a music event he hosted! He went above and beyond of being a good host, I highly recommend staying with him!

You cannot beat the location of his (Website hidden by Airbnb) only 20 minutes away from Times Square, and for the price, it's an amazing deal.

My boyfriend and I stayed for five nights in early January. Patrick was very accommodating and allowed us to check in early and check out late since the scheduling worked out. The room and apartment are clean and are as pictured on the listing. He was very knowledgeable about the city and give us some useful tips. The location is quite good. Thanks for a great stay! We would stay here again in the future!
He was a good host,and for us, the location was perfect.
Great place and great location.  Easy communication.  Warm hospitality.

I had a nice experience (my first time trying this) at Patrick's place.  He helped me with my luggage (both coming and going) and is a gentleman!  My room was well prepared and was clean and nice.  Ditto for the bathroom!  At night it was quiet and peaceful.  And overall great experience for my first time, and I would return!

We very much enjoyed staying in Patrick's apartment. The location is perfect - close to Subway and right next to Central Park. The apartment is clean and has all needed amenities. While the bedroom is not large, private bathroom is a big plus. Patrick is very courteous, willing to help, and is a pleasure to interact with. Overall, a very good experience.

Patrick was really organised and welcoming. The apartment was clean and beautiful, and the location was perfect: next to Central Park and very close to two subway stations. Though it was winter, the apartment was warm and comfy. The experience was great!
Enjoyed stay.gr8 location.  Large apt and private bath. Very nice.
It was my first time using the website. Had a pleasant and safe stay. Definitely recommend.

We loved the location of Patrick's apartment. The bed was comfortable and the apartment was clean. Patrick was quick to answer our questions and concerns. I would definitely recommend this place to travelers who want a quiet place that is close to the subway and central park. It was nice having internet access, our own bathroom and the use of the kitchen.

Patrick's place is in a perfect location, overlooking the gorgeous Central Park, and Central Park West is such a beautiful street. Everything in New York is so easy to get to on the subway, and the Wholefoods five minutes away made me very happy :)
The apartment is nice and warm, cosy and althogh has it's quirks (like most New York apartments do), it's such a fun place to stay in. 
Do your washing at the dry cleaners right next door, and go for coffee at Birch, just up the road on Columbus. 
It's a very quiet, peaceful place to stay. It made for a perfect little home while I explored and fell in love with New York.

We had a very pleasent stay at Patricks. He was very nice and we very much enjoyed being there. Clean place with fine space, and our own bathroom. 
The location was amazing near by central park almost in the back yard, and close to the subway. 
We will like to come back to NYC and Patrick.

A great location across from Central Park, just a block from 96th St subway.  A small but charming apartment; the climb to the fourth storey is steep with luggage.  The room is cosy and quiet and Patrick is a discreet and welcoming host.  It was a pity that the building suffered a hot water outage during my stay but these things happen: the cold shower was exhilarating!

We enjoyed staying in this nice, clean and quite apartement. The beautiful old building is located close to Central Park and the subway station with shops and starbucks or birch for a coffee not far away. We find everything in the room that we need, including free wi-fi. We had a pleasent stay while we explored New York and we recommend this place to anyone who is visting New York. Thanks to Patrick.

Oui le logement a répondu à mes attentes, la localisation en face de central park était parfaite. Et les accès au transport en commun très facile.
La chambre et la salle de bain privées sont très agréables.
The appartment is a great location. It was really easy to access to main places using Subway and Bus. Patrick was avalaible and gave us few address during our stay.
Patrick was a very good host and I was very pleased with the room. Location was perfect. A few minutes promenadr from Central Park. I can really recommend Patrick as host. Friendly and serviceminded.

Patrick's appartement is in a very nice location and a great place if you want to explore nyc. The Appartement itself is also a cool place, but because it's a little older not very well soundproofed. That isnt a problem if you bring oropax though. Patrick was friendly and helpful. We had a good time here

Spent a fabulous week in NYC. We stayed in Patrick's apartment in a bedroom with our own en suite bathroom. Patrick was a charming host, gave us friendly advice when asked and made us feel welcome at all times. We were able to make breakfast each day in a well equipped kitchen and on 2 nights we ate dinner in bought from the Wholefoods Market 2 blocks away. Apartment is in an ideal location opposite Central Park to walk and jog daily as well as within a 5 minute walk to the subway. Was nice to come back to the apartment in a quiet area after a long day in the noisy bustle of the city. Highly recommend the location and apartment for those who want a holiday in New York.
We had a great stay with Patrick, he's a pro at this!

this was the first time my boyfriend and i had used airbnb and Patricks place was perfect. Excellent location, right next to Central Park and only a block away from the subway and is very nice and quiet. The bed is comfortable and everything was clean and we had a brilliant stay. Patrick is very nice and gave us tips about getting places and things to do- we definitely recommend staying here!

Ottima posizione di fronte a central park parte nord ovest del parco. Appartamento carino a pulito, stanza con bagno privato ma molto piccola. Puo' andare bene per una coppia ma non per due amici o come nel mio caso mamma (Website hidden by Airbnb) letto in realta' e' da una piazza e mezza, pochissimo spazio oltre al letto e piuttosto buia con finestra che da sul muro di fronte. Gradevole invece il salone/cucina.
Brutta sorpresa 4° piano senza ascensore con scale strette e ripide...portatevi un bagaglio leggero!! Per noi che essendo in giro da un mese avevamo due sansonite e' stato un incubo salire. 
Sicuramente per quella cifra meglio andare in hotel che alla fine si trovano con ottime offerte e piu' centrali.
Il padrone di casa che era via non aveva lasciato neanche del latte o del succo di frutta per la mattina.
Estremamente rigido sull'orario di cgeck in e check out, non puoi minimamente cambiarlo.
Inconclusione non ci tornerei.

This is our second time staying with Patrick and we had a wonderful time again. 

The apartment is in an ideal location with accessible public transport and plenty of restaurants and coffee shops within walking distance. 

Central Park is right across the street making for a quiet respite from the city whenever the mood takes you. 

Patrick is an excellent host, professional, friendly and courteous. The check in procedure was very easy and the level of information provided by Patrick in advance hugely helpful. 

I would highly recommend staying here for anybody looking to spend some time in New York.

We had an amazing stay at Patrick's place! Patrick is a very good host who will always help you. He is very clear and fast in his communication about the rental and always answers all of your questions. I loved that he gave us some tips&tricks about what to visit in the city. The apartment was very clean and tidy and easy accessible by public transportation. We are certainly visiting New York again soon and would love to stay at Patrick's place again! Thank you Patrick, you really made us feel at home.

Wir haben uns bei Patrick sehr wohl gefühlt. Er ist sehr freundlich. Alles war sehr unkompliziert.
Die Lage ist super, direkt am Central Park in der Upper Westside gelegen. 
Unser Zimmer und Bad waren sauber.

Wir können ihn auf jeden Fall sehr weiterempfehlen.

Goede ligging en warm ontvangst, enkele leuke suggesties van Patrick gekregen, metro dichtbij en Central Park aan de overkant. Hadden alles wat we nodig hadden jammer dat het op de vierde verdieping was

Although we did not meet Patrick, we were pleased with our room & ensuite, which are well located in a quiet neighbourhood adjacent to beautiful Central Park. Patrick left detailed information and let us keep our key on the last day so we could collect our bags prior to a very late flight.

Great location next to Central Park in a quiet part of New York and a short 25 minute ride downtown to all the major NYC sites. The room was clean with ensuite. Patrick wasn't there during our stay but he provided a good check in service and was contactable via phone and email if we needed. I would recommend Patricks place if you are looking to stay in NYC.

Excellent choice, excellent location. Patrick was very good about accommodating my late arrival, sending me an e-mail with detailed instructions -- and photos -- on how and where to access the keys. He's a discreet, almost invisible host, very respectful of the apartment being "mine" while I was there.

The apartment is quiet and, as advertised, is very close to the subway and, a couple of blocks west, to restaurants and a Whole Foods on Columbus Ave. Central Park is right across the street.

The room is fair sized with a comfortable queen-size bed, a table and chair, shelving for clothes and miscellaneous gear, air and heat (though I didn't need either on my early October stay), and a complete bathroom (shower, sink, toilet -- though with no real cabinet space for your toiletries). 

Note: the apartment is on the fourth floor with no elevator; if you have knee problems, or are traveling with lots of luggage, it may not be the right choice for you.
Great place to stay. Clean, comfortable, practical, cheap. Great communication skills of the host.

Our stay at Patrick´s place was just great. Room and ensuite bathroom are exactly as described, neat and cozy. The neighborhood is very safe, across the street you can step into Central Park and the sub (B,C) is only 3-5 minutes away. Patrick is a very friendly and considerate host, he gave us useful tips and made us (Email hidden by Airbnb) munication with him was always easy. 
We would love to come back, soon!
Awesome location, perfect room, great communication. I would recommend Patrick and his home to anybody and everybody!
Well located room in NYC.
Very good location. Access to the flat very well explained. I did not meet Patrick as he was away. The room is small as is the bathroom but OK for a short stay. Excellent Wifi.

We stayed for a week and everything was excellent. The room and location were as described. The flat was clean and cozy. The neighbourhood safe and calm. Few minutes away from the flat there are 2 subway lines, bus stops, food shops and everything needed.

Even if Patrick wasn't at home during that week the communications were great and we found all the information we needed printed on the table.

Highly recommended to everybody visiting NYC.

The room and the location of the apartment were exactly as described/shown in the pictures.
The location is fantastic - quiet, two subway stations within 5 minutes walk, some essential shops around the corner and Central Park just across the street.
Patrick was a very nice, easy to talk to, interested and resourceful.

Patrick's place is a real find.  Nice common area and a bedroom that is exactly as billed in the listing, with a very comfy bed for two.  Nice to have the private bath.  Being three short blocks to the subway and the 96 crosstown bus made all sightseeing very easy.

Patrick was at home to greet us on arrival. The apartment is clean and quiet and our bedroom and private bath were just as advertised. The building has some of the quirks that come with old age but we were entirely comfortable there and would stay again.
It was our first time with airbnb and we had a great experience at patrick's apartment. The place is nice, clean and well situated and Patrick is a perfect host.

Patrick was a great host- very helpful and accommodating and gave us some great advice regarding things to do and see. The apartment is located in a lovely area in the Upper West Side which is very close to bus stations and the subway. The room is comfortable, clean and we would definitely stay there again. Thanks Patrick!

Patrick was a great host. Everything worked smoothly and super relaxed. The apartment is very nice, only the small shower took some time to get used to. The location right next to central park, very close to a subway and just a block away from Starbucks and Whole Foods is awesome.
I will go there again for sure if I need to go back to New York.
Patrick was a nice host, always available and helpful. So glad me and my dad decided to stay at this charming little apartment rather than a boring hotel room. Great location too! Enjoy!

My companion and I, both in our 70s, enjoyed our 11 days with Patrick very much.  For us, the trip was primarily about music and dance and mostly at Lincoln Center.  There is a convienient subway stop 3 short blocks away, which made our trips to Lincoln Center and other parts of the city quick and easy. We also enjoyed our walks in snow covered Central Park, across the street from the apartment.

I especially enjoyed my conversations with Patrick the composer, about music, especially his take on new music.  I came home with some CDs of his compositions and have played them several times in the 6 days I have been home.  They are very enjoyable!

Patrick was very available to answer questions and help us out with ideas since he works from home.  We had the livingroom/kitchen area pretty much to ourselves.

There was plenty of room in the refrigerator and cupboard for the food we bought at the nearby Whole Foods store.

If I ever get back to NYC, I will stay with Patrick if his place is available.

This was our third visit and stay and it will not be our last. Patrick is a fantastic host and made our time in the snow warm and welcoming. 

I would highly recommend staying here to anybody visiting New York. The location is ideal - right on the Park - with public transport and coffee places right on your doorstep. The room is comfortable and the host terrific.

Perfect located appartment. Very close to the subway, different supermarkets and restaurants. Patrick has been a really nice and helpful host. Due to the age of the building (and the heating system) it has been really hot during the night. All in all I would highly recommend to stay at Patricks. As I mentioned before he was very helpful and told us about fancy places to go. In addition, he provided useful things like several adapter boards from different countries. All my best to Patrick and his flatmate. By the way, Upper Westside rocks your socks!

Patrick had an accurate description of his room, and he was a helpful and engaging host. The location was terrific, right on Central Park, which was perfect for us, as we are runners.  We took a lovely walk through the park to the Met as well.  Thank you Patrick!
Patrick was so welcoming and recommended great spots to check out. His place was beautiful and in a great location in the city! We will be back :)

Patrick was incredibly accommodating.  A very nice guy.  He had a document in the bedroom that had great tips on what to do in the city.  Wish we could have chatted with him more.  Me and the gf would love to come back to his spot in the future.

Nous sommes arrivés tard dans la nuit. Les recommandations pour récupérer les clés étaient très claires! 
Logement très bien situé et typique new-yorkais, au pied de Central Park. 
Super séjour!
Excellent stay

Séjour agréable dans une chambre simple avec salle de bain privative ; idéalement située dans Manhattan (à un passage piéton de Central Park, proche métro, commerce dans le quartier qui est tranquille).
Hôte discret mais accommodant.
Patrick has been a great host for our short stay in NY. He has given good advice on what to see and do in the neighbourhood and the apartment is perfectly situated for Central Park.
Good experience, the place was clean and comfortable.  The location is very good close to Central Park and the Underground.  Patrick was friendly and gave me all the information and directions.

Patrick is a very nice person, and his apartment is very lovely. 
Didn't get a chance to say goodbye with him, but definitely will live in his apartment if I go to visit NY again.

Honestly, we only need a place to sleep at night, so this was perfect for us. It was a great value and met our needs. The room was cozy, we felt very welcome, and were able to come and go as we pleased. We only saw Patrick the first day. After that we left early and came in late. The only suggestion I have for anyone coming to explore NYC is to make sure you realize that 100th Street is quite far from Times Square. We did a lot of walking an finally resorted to using the subway, but some of the stations were under construction so even that did not save us much time or money. We ended up having to take a cab quite often. All in all, for two women exploring NYC and tagging along on our children's school trip, it was a perfect place to stay that saved us a ton of money!! We felt safe and really enjoyed walking through Central Park!

Patrick was a great host, he was there to welcome us and help with our bags, and gave us some tips for getting around the city. We didnt see much of him but we were welcome to come and go from the apartment as we pleased. The room was a perfect size for the two of us, and the bathroom was well appointed. The location is great, literally a few steps away from central park, and very handy for catching the subway or getting a cab. Overall we were really happy with our stay.

Patrick took time to show us around and talk to us about any questions we had. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about NYC. The space was clean and comfortable with groceries very near by. The location was perfect. We loved walking through Central Park and being so close to the subway. We also appreciated the nice write up of information and recommendations Patrick gave us. We would definitely stay again!
Patrick was great and his place is in a great location - easy access to subway, the beautiful Central Park just over the road was such a bonus !  We loved it !
Patrick was super accommodating with early bag drop off and late bag retrieval! He made it really easy to grab a key and access the apartment before official check in time. That was much appreciated.

This was our first airbnb experience, and we will definitely do it again. The loft was clean and attractive, the bed was comfortable, and the location was perfect for walking to the Metropolitan Museum, great restaurants, Central Park, and the subway. We weren't expecting to have a private bathroom, so it was a pleasant surprise. Patrick was pleasant and helpful, giving us directions and suggestions to make getting around town easier. Though he lives and works in the apartment, we only saw him once. From his profile we knew that he was very accomplished, and  would have loved a little more interaction, but with only 2 days in New York we were up and out early, and stayed out late. If we travel to New York again, we would be happy to stay there again.

Wow- this neighbourhood was fantastic.  We were uptown - quite a way uptown, but close to Central Park and some excellent restaurant & shopping areas close by.  Easy to get everywhere - particularly by subway.  Its a hike up the stairs, but once you are there, it is a quiet clean haven from the city.
We enjoyed our stay. We were well taken care of in great accommodations.  Patrick has a great personality and is very nice .
Wonderful location. Patrick & roommate very helpful. When it turned out we had extra guests, Patrick rented us his room too!

We had a lovely stay at Patricks place. It is a nice apartment and we felt at home from the beginning. Patrick is a warm and welcoming person who is very easy to communicate with. Everything went smoothly and Patrick is helpfull. 
I would defenitly come back!
perfect

We enjoyed our time in NY (July) ,even though for our stay it was very hot.
The roomy apartment (4th floor -no lift) is well situated near the subway and the wonderful Central Park is just over the road. Having our own bathroom was great. The bed was comfortable , but quite noisy , if you worry about such things. The subway noise was like very distant thunder,but hey you are close to the subway.
While we were there ,we needed the air-conditioning as there are few windows that open. This would probably not be a problem in cooler weather.
Patrick answered all our email requests effectively, and provided lots of useful information. He greeted us on our first day and discussed things we could do, and his role in the local music scene.( he is a composer/producer). Unfortunately this line of work meant that we hardly saw Patrick again ,for the rest of the week .
We found the apartment to be a great base for a busy week in NY

We had a wonderful stay at Patrick's apartment.  Patrick was very pleasant and quite thoughtful.  He helped us carry our luggage up the four flights of steps to his apartment. We very much appreciated that after a long day of travel. He had lots of helpful info about NYC.
His apartment was clean, comfortable and well organized.  Our bed and bath was also very comfy and felt nice and private. 
The apartment was truly a haven within the city.  It was located in a lovely neighborhood.  Central Park West was right across the street, the subway was readily accessible. There was so much that was available, Whole Foods, museums, restaurants, etc.
We were absolutely delighted with our NYC experience.
Patrick was very accommodating and helpful.  The apartment and description was as described and I would definitely recommend it to friends.

"The best" location for a NY trip - walk to Central Park, Museums, the subway, Whole Foods etc.
Very nice bedroom, private bathroom, kitchen with refrigerator, microwave and stove available.
For a wonderful, authentic NY stay. Thank you so much for a wonderful 6 days Patrick.
Patrick's apartment is conveniently located, clean and comfortable, and he was available to answer any questions when required. I would certainly stay here again.

This room at Patrick's place was ideal for my husband and I. The room and the whole flat had a quintessentially New York feel to it, with sufficient space and spots to store our luggage, and the private bathroom. We also found the bed comfortable and slept really well, although as someone else said, in hot weather you may need to rely on the air-conditioner. 

Patrick wasn't there when we checked in, but it was seamless, and we bumped into him a couple of times later. He's very warm and friendly. Would stay here again if the opportunity arose.
It's ok.littele but fine.Patrick is ok
Exactly as described. We were delighted with our stay. Perfect location for Central Park and access to the subway to anywhere you please!

Suitable for young mobile travellers would have appreciated being informed that 8 flights of stairs  to room with no lift and we had very heavy suitcases as we were at the start of a 9 week holiday of which I had advised Patrick. He was unapologetic about being late to meet us and appeared disinterested in our plight. We had to pay a passer by to carry our bags upstairs and we could not access the room until after 3 pm as it had not been prepared. We were exhausted from having to stand around waiting for him and we had no access to any ablutions and had to go to the local deli where the toilets were disgusting. Patrick had no soap in the bathroom and told us that most of the travellers bring their own soap??? He didn't have tea or coffee available for us to utilise as he said he changed the way he was operating but hadn't advised me and as I had already been to the shop I was annoyed that I hadn't been told before. To his credit he went to the shop and bought soap and shampoo and he also gave us his coffee beans and grinder so we could make coffee. At the end of our stay he did take our suitcases down to the pavement and hailed a taxi. Overall a disappointing experience for us and makes us reluctant to use the service again. Great location

We stayed for 4 nights at the flat, and would recommend the room to anyone who is looking for an accomodation thats in a safe area, within easy reach to downtown and near the central park. We arrived sometime after midnight and Patrick had arranged for us to get the keys easily. Similarly we were allowed to store our luggage for the last day in the flat as we had an evening flight back home. The room was clean, quiet (ie no traffic or other noise) and the bed was comfortable and big enough for 2. We met patrick a few times and he was very friendly and shared some good advice e.g. with regard to airport logistics. The property is right next to central park and a short walk from the subway.

Patrick is a terrific host! Extremely organized and communicative, all the more amazing given that he's usually booked solid and has a full and demanding career. He was really gracious in showing flexibility when I got unexpectedly caught up at my conference.

 I went for a nice evening walk around the neighborhood and had dinner and a great Brooklyn ale at the bar at Henry's and picked up my breakfast at Whole Foods on the way back. 15 minutes door to door this morning to my conference at the Sheraton Times Square, on the B train.  Much quieter and more interesting neighborhood, even if your work brings you to a different part of town.

I did not get to meet Patrick since I was caught up at work, but hope to do so on another stay. The flat is just as depicted -- interesting, comfortable, not loud by Manhattan standards. Bedroom cools quickly with window unit AC. 

Overall, great value in a great location. I so appreciated having a private bathroom and a great bedroom/comfy bed.

Perfect little spot and very much the quintessential NY experience. Central Park was across the street - so handy to get in there and walk around. Patrick was warm and friendly. The room was great - really enjoyed my stay (2 nights). You probably need to use the in room air-con to cool the room down during summer. You do need to be able to carry your luggage up 4 flights of stairs - there's no lift...but it's totally doable. Overall, really enjoyed staying here - very clean, convenient and great host.

Patrick was very helpful and available with all the information we needed on arrival, especially as I managed to lose his email with details of how to access the key.  The apartment was just as described, the room very comfy with great use of space, and useful information waiting for us on local knowledge, shops, banks and tourism tips.  Location was great for us right opposite Central Park and near two subway stations.   We made good use of the wifi, and it was terrific to have an ensuite bathroom.

L'appartement est tel que représenté sur les photos. La chambre est petite et simple, mais confortable et propre. L'hôte est discret, mais accueillant. Il est disponible en cas de besoin.
L'appartement est bien situé et facile d'accès. Plusieurs stationnements gratuits sont disponibles la fin de semaine sur la même rue.

Patrick is a very open, friendly and welcoming person. We had a nice chat when we arrived and felt very comfortable in his home. The room is just as in the description. The location right next to central park is perfect!
I had an absolutely amazing stay in Upper West Side. Patrick is very friendly. I would come back any time.

Patrick's place was perfect for our visit!  He was very accommodating with our schedule and quickly responded to any of our questions.  His place is just as described and is in a quiet neighborhood right on Central Park.  We were there over Halloween and it was still quiet.  It was clean and spacious enough for the two of us in the room.  I would highly recommend staying with him and will definitely do so if I go back to NYC.

Patrick nous a reçus avec beaucoup de gentillesse et nous a aidés à monter nos bagages au 4ème étage.( Nous ne sommes pas très jeunes)
Il nous a montré notre chambre et expliqué les règles pour la cuisine. (emplacement dans le frigo etc)
Etre près de Central Park est génial, idem pour les métros. Il faut simplement accepter que nous logeons dans une chambre plutôt petite,mais bien équipée d'une salle de bain, comme prévu, dans un appartement vers Central Park. L'immeuble de briques est authentique et a son charme. Le quartier est très agréable et sûr. Il y a de nombreux bons restaurants suggérés par Patrick, à 10 minutes à pied! Traversant Central Park, nous sommes allés à pied au Metropolitan Museum ainsi qu'au National History Park. En métro, nous avons été à Battery Park où nous avons pris le Ferry pour Ellis Island.
Comme il a fait beau nous avaons pu largement profiter de notre séjour.
Patrick,  thank you so much for hosting. Lovely place and you were perfect.

De kamer en appartement zien er uit zoals op de foto. Het is er rustig, wat in New York vaak niet het geval is. De ligging is heel goed:  2 blokken verwijderd van een goede subway-verbinding en aan Central Park!

Het bed is ok voor New York-normen. Niet heel lang en breed, maar wel heel goed in geslapen.

Patrick is een goede gast en heel klantvriendelijk. We konden na het uitchecken onze valiezen nog de ganse dag laten staan, zodat we voor onze laatste dag onze valiezen niet moesten meesleuren...

Als je rustig wil slapen: niet twijfelen.
Indien je in een leuke buurt met restaurants wil verblijven, dan is dit niet de beste optie.

Our stay was ok! The only thing was, that the bathroom was Not clean and there is a hole in the ceileing, means when his neighbours from 5th floor take a shower the water is coming to 4th floor. The room was not very clean and the fridge as well. WE decided to buy nothing, which has to be done into the fridge. I would not recommanded his place!
Es hat alles hat wunderbar geklappt und Patrick ist ein grossartiger Gastgeber. Wir würden die Unterkunft jederzeit wieder buchen!
Patrick made us feel very welcome and was very helpful providing advice on getting to places. Apartment was very close to subway which made navigating NYC easy.

As a first time Airbnb user, Patrick was a fantastic first experience. The room was great; private bathroom attached to the room, towels and other basics provided. He gave us the space we wanted so we could come and go as we pleased. The apartment itself was very nice, not too big or small. Enough space to not feel like you have to be quiet or disturb anyone. Patrick was very helpful in providing us with an app to help us navigate the city. Also, he was very accommodating to our schedule allowing us to check-in early.

Patrick's flat was perfect place  for our visit.  He was very wonderful host. His place is just as described and is in a nice neighborhood ,very closely to the central park . It was clean and spacious enough for the two of us in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) bathroom was a very comfortable and private. The Patrick's recommendations about the city was a interesting , and gave a wonderful complement  our itinerary.

 I would highly recommend staying with him and will definitely do so if I go back to NYC.

Patrick was very nice and always available to give infortmation and tips for NYC. The apartment is 2 blocks far from a subway station, so it is very useful. On the other side the room is cold and dusty and the bathroom has a leak in the ceiling, above the bath tub.

My fiance and I had such a great experience. Patrick was very welcoming and sweet. I appreciated how helpful he was whenever we had any questions about the city. The recommendations given to us were awesome. The room was quaint and clean. My favourite part was that it comes with its own bathroom. We will definitely be staying here when we come back to NY!

The listing was accurate as the pictures showed.
Pros: Good, clean, cozy apartment. Many restaurants nearby. Friendly host.
Cons: The lighting was dim, the bed creaked a lot and the shower faucet was difficult to control.

I had a very quick stay, but the room was comfortable and Patrick was very welcoming and accommodating. It was great having a private bathroom, though a pipe burst in the building so I never got to use the shower. The location is super convenient. All around, a nice oasis in the city.
It's a very nice clean room with a bathroom, and I spent a happy weekend there with my friend:)
Patrick was a great host. He is responsive, courteous and pleasant. His place is as described.

Everything was as promised- the bed was especially comfortable and despite our weekend stay in this busy neighborhood/building, the nights were quiet and restful.
Patrick made getting into the apartment easy, we felt free to come and go and had plenty of private space.
Loved the little bathroom that was ours alone.
Patrick makes great suggestions for nearby food ( we enjoyed Tom's Restaurant) and the subway is crazy close for exploring the rest of the city.

très bon accueil, chambre et SDB  propre, bon couchage et appartement calme, (nous avons dormis comme des bébés ;-)
confort simple
merci Patrick pour votre accueil, il a fortement contribué à l'excellent séjour que nous avons passé à NY

We stayed with Patrick for three nights.  The description is accurate, but it cannot describe what a gracious host he is.  He was available when questions needed answering or recommendations needed and was quick to respond to guests' requests.  This is in addition to being  a talented composer working from home. Great uptown location that we would visit again while in NYC.

Patrick fue un buen anfitrión. Nos sentimos cómodos en el departamento, con la libertad de ir y volver cuando queríamos.
El departamento cuenta con buena calefacción, los vecinos son tranquilos y queda a dos cuadras del metro.
Los espacios del departamento son un poco más pequeños de lo que parecen en las fotos. El WiFi no funcionó bien durante la estadía, trataron de arreglarlo pero de igual manera la velocidad, algunos días, sólo sirvió para chatear.
El día que nos íbamos Patrick nos permitió dejar nuestras maletas en el living para volver a buscarlas más tarde de la hora del check out

Hello Patrick,
Thanks again for your welcome. We loved your house. It was great to be close to central Park where we took all our breakfast. It was a quiet place with very good situation.
Our trip was wonderful!
We will come back and for sure we will try to rent your home again.

See you soon ! 
Florie & Oliver

Listing was completely accurate, apartment terrifc. Clean, attractive and easy to find. Due to our getting there late, did not meet Patrick in person, but he was very clear about how to get in, and supplied the information immediately when we needed it.
Patrick was great!  The apartment was quiet and right on Central Park.  The subway was close by and I felt safe getting back during the day or evening.

We are seasoned travellers and stayed in the room with a bathroom for 8 nights. The best thing about the apartment was its location  - just across the road from Central Park and close to the subway.
Our host was not able to meet us in person but made arrangements  for us to collect the key to the apartment and let ourselves in and find our own room. Our room was smaller than what we had expected from the photos and info provided. The bathroom was small but well appointed except for a loose toilet seat.
We did not meet our host face to face until day 3 of our stay but had emailed him on 
arrival to say we had got in but also to ask if he could exchange flanalette sheets with cotton because of the heat (in spite of the air conditioner). We also  informed him that there had been no room in the fridge for us to put our provisions and that I had moved things from a shelf to make (Website hidden by Airbnb) received an email response that evening telling us that this was an old building, we needed to lower our expectations and have due regard for the needs of other guests who had left provisions. At this point we were the only ones in the apartment and were unaware that there were other guests at this time.
 The sheets issue was never addressed but we met the other guests the next morning and introduced ourselves. We were surprised that there were no locks on the doors of the rented rooms.
We would describe this as more of a share house arrangement rather than hosted accommodation and this was disappointing.

Just returned from an 8 day stay at Patrick's and had the most amazing time! Location was great as it was close to a number of subway lines and the apartment itself was exactly like in the photos. Patrick was always really helpful with recommendations and advice on where's good to go. I was a bit hesitant at first as I've never done Air BnB before however would definitely stay again and recommend strongly to others to check it out!

Patrick oli erittäin ystävällinen ja aina valmis auttamaan ja tarjoamaan apuaan, jos oli jotain kysyttävää. Huone vastasi sitä, mitä kuvaus ja valokuvat lupasivat. Sijainti oli erittäin hyvä. Liikkuminen julkisilla kulkuvälineillä oli helppoa ja sujuvaa. Kaikin puolin positiivinen kokemus.
Patrick is kind and available. The space is nice.

Patrick's place on Central Park is nice and tidy, and located in one of the most beautiful and tranquil parts of the city. You will definitely get some good exercise climbing the stairs each day and have a quiet place to unwind. We did not have a chance to meet Patrick, but he was very communicative before and throughout our stay. Thanks, Patrick!

This apartment is in an excellent spot near the subway and Central Park yet relatively quiet. The bedroom is small but adequate, and the private bathroom makes sharing the quarters very comfortable. The kitchen and fridge space are well-organized. The piano was a bonus for my teenaged daughter, who enjoys playing. Patrick was away during our visit. Others came and went, but were quiet and neat. All in all, a fine place to stay in NYC on a budget.

Patrick was a very hospitable and helpful host, and more than happy to recommend places to eat and visit. The apartment was in a great location, in a safe neighbourhood just a few blocks from 96th St metro (for those new to NY make sure you get the local stopping train to get off for Patrick's, otherwise you'll end up at 125th - we found out the hard way!). The Whole Foods round the block was great for grabbing food to/from downtown!

The room itself was clean and a welcome respite after a long days exploring. The air con in the room made a big difference,p particularly at night.

Overall, a really great experience and we definitely hope to return.

Thanks Patrick!

Patrick war sehr gastfreundlich und hat uns Tipps gegeben, wo man frische Bio Lebensmittel bekommt. Im Kühlschrank hatten wir einen Platz für unsere Lebensmittel. Die gesamte Wohnung war sauber und ordentlich gehalten. Das Zimmer mit angrenzendem Bad ist zwar klein aber zum Schlafen total ausreichend. Es war alles da was man braucht. Es gibt noch ein weiteres Zimmer in dem auch Gäste untergebracht waren. Patrick haben wir nur zwei mal kurz angetroffen und die anderen Gäste haben wir gar nicht gesehen oder gehört.

Patrick was great from the moment I first contacted him about the listing. He was very kind and quick to reply to messages. He helped us figure out the best route to the apartment, gave us great recommendations for restaurants in the area and things to do. The apartment itself was lovely, the room and bed were very comfortable and clean, Wifi worked well, and we had everything we needed at hand. The location was excellent, a few blocks from the subway and numerous shops and restaurants. Overall, our experience was excellent and Patrick is an excellent host.
Great location close to metro and nice organic supermarket. Patrick was very helpful upon our arrival and helped out with metro, where to buy groceries etc. We would love to stay there again.
Great location and apartment, very clean and spacious. Patrick was clear and accommodating! Would stay here again next trip!

Wir haben Patrick, da er auf einer Geschäftsreise war nicht persönlich getroffen. Er hat sich aber per Mail oft gemeldet und gefragt ob alles gut bei uns ist. Das zweite Zimmer war auch vermietet, aber wir haben nur Spät am Abend die anderen Gäste mal gehört, gesehen eigentlich nie. Man ist eh den ganzen Tag unterwegs. Das Zimmer mit dem Bad on Suite ist zwar klein aber ausreichhend. Ok für mich mit 1,98m war das Bett zu kurz, aber gibt schlimmeres. Die Lage ist Top, zum Einkaufen geht man zwar 10 Minuten aber gegenüber ist direkt der Central Park und die U Bahn Station.

We absolutely LOVED staying in Patrick's place! Not only is Patrick's listing and description accurate, but he is a super host who made us feel totally at ease. He was incredibly kind to accommodate our earlier-than-planned arrival and made it easy to come and go as we needed. This room is a total gem and the ensuite bathroom is the cherry on the top. The only problem was that we had a flight back home and could not stay longer! Thanks for a great stay, Patrick!

I really enjoyed Patrick's place. It was a great location in a really nice space. The room and bathroom were clean, and being right next to Central Park was great. Patrick was easy to communicate with, and considering our shared musical background it's too bad we didn't get to talk more. However I would certainly stay there again if I could.

Patrick me recibió en un espacio tal cual lo describe, es una excelente locación. La habitación es confortable, la cama es cómoda y hay espacio de guardado. Cómo nota sumo que la puerta de la habitación debería tener llave puesto que uno de los otros huéspedes entró a mi habitación por accidente y fue muy incómodo. El barrio es muy tranquilo y tiene supermercados y starbucks a muy corta distancia. A 2 cuadras está el metro y pasan varias líneas de bus. 
Definitivamente volvería a quedarme en su casa.

Gracias Patrick! Thanks a lot Patrick!
Had a great stay! Clean place and a friendly host in a great location!

Alojamiento muy acogedor, espacioso, bien ubicado y en un lugar tranquilo de la ciudad. 
Nos sentimos muy cómodos y bien atendidos por Patrick.

Excellent stay: No surprises. Patrick’s description of the accommodations is complete and accurate and he is a responsive and accommodating host.  

Location: Convenient to public transit and an Avis mid-town location.  Lovely 15-min walk across Central Park to Mt. Sinai, which was the reason for our visit.

Accommodation: The space was very clean and the bedroom provides ample and efficient storage for clothes and outlets for recharging devices.  The bed is comfortable and the room is really well noise-insulated allowing for a great night’s sleep.  The private shower/tub is very nice and an assortment of personal care products are provided.

Temperature Note:  I especially appreciated the window fan and aircon unit.  I found the space warm even in early November, which was likely a combination of me being post menopause and also an older building / 4th floor.  The window unit kept me very comfortable, but from an energy conservation perspective I felt guilty and in hindsight would have packed shorts and t-shirt.

Host:  Patrick was very responsive and accommodating.

Great stay – recommend with no hesitations.
Patrick's apartment was exactly as described and impeccably clean. Private bath is in the bedroom which gave us complete privacy.  Patrick was very accommodating and a perfect host.
Great location and space.
快適に過ごすことができました｡築100年を超えたｱﾊﾟｰﾄですが､十分綺麗だと思います｡家主のPatrickもいい人でした｡

This was my first time staying in someone's home--usually we take a whole apartment.  Patrick was a great host.  He made me feel welcome and seems sincerely interested in people. This was a solo trip for me, and my ensuite room was perfect in every way--clean, quiet, with a bed, chair, night table, open shelving and clothes rod.  Great location in an interesting neighborhood.  3-min walk to the subway.

Patrick is great about access, too--he is on,top of communication and arranging initial entry, and lets guests leave luggage if their flight is well after check-out.

The room was tee-shirt warm for my visit.  Bring a personal reading light if you read in bed.  As mentioned in the listing, there may be other guests staying in Patrick's other room.

The neighborhood was great! There were many shops and restaurants nearby.  For groceries, there was a Whole Foods as well as a locally owned natural foods store. There was a Wash and Fold on our block, and a laundromat about a 10 minute walk away. It was really nice to be directly next to Central Park, and we didn't have any trouble with transportation or getting around.

The apartment was as described, and had an urban, Spartan feel. As a musician who booked this apartment primarily because it has a piano, I was disappointed at the very limited availability of time due to Patrick working from home most days, as well as his concern about disturbing the neighbors. The piano was also not in great shape, and had problems with sticking dampers.

Patrick was cultured and metropolitan, accommodating when we requested extra towels and a later check out time, and was available when we needed anything. We enjoyed our time staying here. Thank you, Patrick!

Patrick ist ein wirklich netter und gelassener junger Mann. Wir haben uns  wie daheim gefühlt. Das Zimmer ist wie beschrieben, geräumig und perfekt für einen Städtetrip. Die einzigen Mängel sind, dass es keinen Aufzug gibt und das Apartment im 4. Stock liegt. Das Bett war nicht ganz so bequem, aber das ist meckern auf hohem Niveau!! Patrick hat auch eine Liste mit Empfehlungen für New York und die Gegend da gelassen, was uns schon zu dem einen oder anderen netten Restaurant geführt hat. Auch so war er immer ansprechbar. Rundum hatten wir einen tollen Aufenthalt und sind sehr zufrieden.

The apartment is located right next to Central Park and about a 3 min walk to the closest subway. Patrick was flexible with our check in, which helped us settle down quickly and he was also very helpful throughout our stay.

Très bon séjour chez Patrick, le logement correspond exactement aux photos, il est bien desservi par le métro, 5 minutes à pieds de la bouche de métro. Nous avons pu en une semaine, parcourir New York.
Great location, easy to access Central Park. Close to whole foods for quick meals on the go... Close to subway to get you into the city. Nice and clean apartment

The place is just as shown on the site. No surprises. The room is quite wide with plenty of space to unpack and make oneself comfortable. The bathroom seems new (or at least is very well kept). The place was pretty clean and very neat. Super cozy and warm during cold days.
The area is very nice to walk around, there are some shops nearby and is really close to subways access.
Although Patrick had some inconvenience on the last minute and couldn't be there for our arrival he was very willing to help us and solve any trouble that came up quickly.

Appartement très bien situé avec toutes les commodités et transports publics à proximité. Cependant, la propreté est très limite et Patrick a été arrangeant pour l'entrée dans les lieux mais a tout de même failli nous oublier (communication seulement par mail, nous ne l'avons pas vu), le prix reste néanmoins très intéressant pour un séjour à New York, les photos sont fidèles à la réalité.

Patrick's apartment on W 100th street was fabulous! His directions for getting into and up into the apartment were flawless and his apartment is impeccable. Very clean, comfortable, and inviting. We stayed in the room with a private bathroom which was just lovely! We only saw Patrick once during our stay because of our busy schedules but when we met him, he was friendly and nice to chat with before we left for the day. We had clean towels and sheets and plenty of blankets. The shelves in the room were nice for unpacking! 

The location of the apartment was stellar. Close to coffee shops, drug stores, and supermarkets. Very convenient to the subway and Central Park is right at your doorstep.

Overall, I give this place a 10/10! We will definitely recommend Patrick's apartment and probably book again in the future! It was perfection.

Patrick was an amazing host. We arrived in New York before the check in time and he let us drop off are bags witch was very nice of him. The apartment is really nice and clean. The location is really good pretty close to everything and right in front of Central Park. Would highly recommend staying here!!!!

Patrick was very welcoming and provided a helpful guide to the apartment and points of interest in New York that the normal tourist may not have known about. Just a short walk to the subway to get you anywhere you need to be. Or if you are feeling active taking a stroll through Central Park is just as enjoyable right across the road. The kitchen and private bathroom made our stay that much more comfortable. Would definitely recommend this apartment to people searching for a quiet location that isn't to far away from the rush of the city.
Great place! This place is the perfect quiet apartment from a long day exploring the city.
Sehr günstig gelegen, ruhig (Hinterhof). Steile Treppe zum 4. Stockwerk. Nicht gepflegte Einrichtung. Nur kleiner Esstisch für 2 Personen. Zimmer und Bad eng.

We stayed with Patrick for 2 days and overall it was a good stay. Check-in was very easy and he provided us with a list of close restaurants that delivered as well as invited us to an event he was putting on at a local club. The decor was very nice with hardwood floors and many items related to the arts were on display. There was coffee and tea provided for the morning and the top shelf of the refrigerator was available for our leftovers. There is a market downstairs that we used to purchase water and alcohol that was convenient. Unfortunately, one of the chairs was broken in the main area making it difficult for us to both sit and eat our take-out. While the bathroom was clean, the shower pressure was low. There was also a decent amount of noise from the neighbors though the AC did a good job of drowning it out. The bed was comfortable. Our location was 4 blocks from the subway and across the street from Central Park. There were many restaurants within walking distance (10 minutes) including a French bakery with great pastries and fruit tarts. Overall it was a pleasant experience.

Patrick was a great host; accommodating and helpful. His place has the cool vibe you'd expect from someone with his creative nature. We loved the location; across from Central Park, easy access to the subway, great coffee and a Whole Foods around the corner. Patrick made us feel welcome and did a great job of giving us our space while being available for conversation or ideas on the what, where and how of New York.

Well-located apartment in a nice neighbourhood, close to shops, underground and Central Park. Confortable bed. The apartment and the whole building could be cleaner. As it is shared with other guests it can be noisy sometimes.

Great location across from the northern part of Central Park. It allowed us to explore over a week the entire park, plus part of Harlem and along 5th and Lexington Avenues. Lots of amenities nearby: small grocery store, convenience store, Starbucks, huge Whole Foods and its wine store. Columbus Ave. is a treat to walk along, with great delis.

Subway stop is two blocks down Central Park West. Zip to Times Square in 15 minutes. However, cabs are cheap and ubiquitous.

Patrick's place is quiet with a roomy common area. We had the room with private bathroom which was convenient. Plenty of space for staring some basic groceries. We didn't buy much but nice to have some breakfast before heading out for the day.

Patrick was good at communication, both in the time leading up to our trip and when we arrived in NYC. He sent a text with an explanation and photos on how to access the keys since he was out for the evening. Very efficient. Check out was a breeze.

Finally, this was a great area to stay because it was away from the craziness in Mid-town. It's also safe and very pretty with the park and architecture.
awsone location, just next to the central park, and 2 minutes to subway.
Communication was easy and Patrick responded quickly.  The apartment was close to the subway.  We enjoyed our stay.

The best is the location, next to a subway station, Central Park, restaurants, supermarket. Patrick was very nice making us feel free to use the apartment and he also was very flexible with our check out. A wonderful stay in New York.

The room at Patrick's place and neat and clean and check in was easy with his detailed instructions. However when I arrived the room was 90 degrees, the air conditioner had to be tinkered with to get it working, and the host did not respond to my inquiry about it until the following morning. Fortunately I got it working well enough to avoid a very sweaty night! I left the apartment early for work both mornings, so never ran into the host or other guests.
Patrick is an incredibly welcoming host. The apartment is very homely and we felt at ease. Great location too. Thank you Patrick!
Great location, right next to central park. Friendly host. Nice to have bathroom attached to the bedroom.
Patrick's apartment is conveniently located to transport and beautiful Central Park. It is also very close to an excellent supermarket should you wish to eat fresh, healthy food.
Great host. Flexible. Very close to the MTA B and C line! Comfortable room, attached bathroom is definitely and advantage.
Our staying was very pleasant, and Patrick appears to be an excellent conversationalist. However, rusty fournitures in the bathroom and VERY dusty window frames took away some of the magic...
My daughter and I had a great stay-- Patrick's place is charming and quiet, and it's easily accessible in a safe neighborhood. I'd definitely book with him again!
Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt im Zimmer und in der Wohnküche. Die Lage am schönen Central Park hat uns gefallen. Die Metro ist auch nicht weit entfernt.

The place is walking distance to a subway and right across central park. The room is small and good for 2 people who does not really plan on staying much in the room. 

Also, just note that the apartment is on the 4th floor with no elevator in case you have issues with climbing up and down the stairs especially with luggages.

Patrick is a good host and very responsive to messages and questions.

This apartment was just as described...only 10 minutes on sub way to town....would definitely recommend  this place. ..just a note though. .this place would not be suited to older people as there is no lift and the apartment is on the 4th floor.....thanks patrick for sharing your home

Patrick is a nice host, always ready to give information and help.The apartment has such a great location, we could jog in Central Park every morning. Also walk through the park to The MET. Nice stay in upside west.

Patrick’s location was amazing. Very nice location, close to subway, just across CPW from the park. Patrick’s helpful tips of the city during checking were great and made out trip that much better! Very centrally located to all things we were interested in doing! Highly recommended.

The photos look  better than the place in reality. The broken and rusted toilet seat cover, dust on the bedroom shelving, dirty microwave all reminded us of a college dorm. We would also expect a decent blanket that covers the entire bed for the price we paid. We ended up leaving early and found a nice hotel room for not much more per day.
Other guests in the next room woke us up after we were asleep. Walls are thin! 
On the plus side, the location next to Central Park and the subway, was convenient. Patrick seems like a nice guy. Check-in and pre arrival communication was thorough and timely.

Patrick’s place is exactly as he describes it. This was our first time using Airbnb in NY and we were pleased. We used the kitchen for breakfast, and loved being right next to Central Park. Transportation was a bit tricky at night do to train maintenance, but during regular hours everything went great, we took the subway from JFK and had no trouble getting there. I would definitely recommend his place. By the way his place is in a third floor, we have no problem going up and down stairs, but it good to know.

I lived on the UWS in college and right after and decades later still have relatives and friends in the neighborhood. It was great pretending to live there again. It is a GREAT location. Steps from the park, a block or two to coffee shops, a large Whole Foods, and near subway lines, loads of restaurants, shops and museums. Patrick is a great host -- responsive to our requests and questions and (drumroll!) he carried our suitcases up and down the 4 flights of stairs.  

The bedroom and (private) bathroom are small and dark. If you have a lot of stuff or expect to spend a lot of time in the apt, you should talk with him and find out if it works for you.
The perfect location for central park and the subway. Loved meeting the other international guests that were also visiting NY. So fun we didn't head out one evening!

Patrick is an amazing host! He is quick to respond to messages and provides such helpful tips about the area. The room isn’t the biggest, but it was still comfortable for two people. Patrick was very flexible when it came to check-in and check-out— allowing us to store our suitcases in the apartment before and after our scheduled times. The location of the apartment is also really nice! I would absolutely recommend staying here.
Patrick's home is warm, accessible to transportation, food and Central Park. His description of his home meet every expectation I had. My experience at his home was lovely.
We had a great stay. Patrick is a very kind host and is incredibly accommodating. The room is comfortable, stylish, and exactly as described. Super close to Central Park and subway lines.
would very much recommend.
Terrific host, and a clean cozy room with a private bath.
Patrick was a great host! Place was a steal for the great location and amenities. Quick response and easy to organize with. Would recommend to anyone.

Patrick à été réactif à toutes nos questions. Il nous a mis à l'aise et partagé son appartement avec amabilité et simplicité. L'immeuble est ancien et pourrait être rénové mais présente du charme et un bon emplacement.

Patrick’s place is absolutely beautiful and he’s a very kind and caring host. Supermarkets are super close, transit system is right next door, and everything in walking distance. Patrick also gives you a good idea of where to go and what to see. Would recommend and stay again :)

Tivemos pouco contato, mas o Patrick sempre estava disponível quando precisamos. Além disso, ele gentilmente se ofereceu para me ajudar a carregas as malas, tanto na chegada quanto na partida. Recomendo a acomodação do Patrick. O local é de fácil acesso e tem muitas lojas úteis por perto, como um mercadinho 24h, uma Starbucks, TJ-Max e um WholeFoods.
Tolle, ruhige Unterkunft, um NYC zu erkunden

I was very much looking forward to meet Patrick and stay in his flat. 
Unfortunately I had to leave after my first night, having spent less than 10 hours in the room due to complete lack of hygiene. 
Patrick and I communicated well since the moment I booked but I was shocked and disappointed that he would think it is acceptable to rent his room in such a state. The floor had been swept and linens and towels were clean, the rest was a disgrace. 
It is such a shame because this is a prime location in Manhattan and the flat for what I could see has a HUGE potential.

Although we couldn’t meet Patrick, everything was perfectly arranged by him. The location is two blocks away from the C line in the heart of the Upper West. Typical NY building and apartment, we felt like locals! The room was spotless clean and really quiet by night. The private bath is a big plus. Keep in mind that is 3-stairs flight to the room with no elevator in the building. We’d definitely come back to Patrick’s again! 10/10

We had a great start with Patrick, who was super friendly and helpful. He gave us great tips on the best places to visit in the city and important treansportation info. Room was clean and organized with fresh sheets and towels.
Perfect location next to central park, quick metro ride to times square, friendly host

Just back from 5 nights at Patrick's place. A really good experience overall. The apartment was in a great location. Got a great night's sleep every night on the comfy bed, and the aircon was a life saver during the hot weather. Patrick was very friendly and went beyond as a host for us. He recommended some great places like Whole foods (my new favourite place), and a place to get discounted broadway tickets! The wifi was great for streaming Netflix too :)
Good value and a good base for the city.

Wir fühlten uns gut aufgehoben bei Patrick, haben ihn jedoch auch nur beim Check in und einmal da nach kurz gesehen. Das Bett könnte etwas größer sein und mit der Dusche muss man erst mal klar kommen, dieses hatte Patrick uns im Vorfeld aber auch gesagt. Allgemein ist das Appartement sehr hellhörig, halt New York üblich und mit Gepäck in den vierten Stock zu kommen ist nicht sehr einfach. Die Lage ist top, direkt am Central Park und zur Subway ist es ein Katzensprung. Ein kleiner Kiosk ist direkt auf der Ecke und zum Frühstücken bieten sich alle Möglichkeiten, wir waren oft bei Mila an der 94sten. Insgesamt haben wir nichts bereut und würden wiederkommen.

Patrick’s place was everything you need an Airbnb in NY to be. It was right by subway and bus stops, and had a clean bedroom and private bathroom. For those who love Central Park, it was right across the street. Which was super great.
Patrick’s place was awesome! Right across from the park and close to public transit. The apartment was super cool, very clean, and it was really nice to have a private bathroom. Thanks for hosting!

Patrick was very nice and very easy to work with. Check in and out was easy. Best part of the stay was the location, right at central park. The room was what we expected. The private bath was nice to have small but nice. Only thing really was the AC unit took a long to cool the room. We did what he asked and turned it off when gone, I would recommend leaving it on or the room gets very warm and muggy.
Room clean & quiet. Easy access to subway. Nice having private bathroom.

Patrick’s apartment is small- but it’s NYC. It’s a great location though, right by Central Park and subway station to get downtown anytime. 
It’s great having a private bathroom and the communication about check in and leaving is great. We left our bags all day just collecting them for the short subway ride then bus to La Guardia. 
Cupboard and fridge space is fine for a few days if you are not eating out.
The place is ideal for a few days in Manhattan - just wish there weren’t 4 flights of stairs when you get back each evening!
