host.host_about: aloha i am mele, i am a treehugger. :)

reviews.comments: The reservation was canceled 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I loved staying here. The top floor was perfect for me and my girlfriend. The house itself would probably be, ideal for a large group. Overall the location is great (Walk to food trucks and beach, short drive to great north shore attractions - Ted's, Waimea Valley, Sharks Cove, etc). We forgot about the toys and snorkels and accidentally rented our own but definitely utilize the community toys.

The house and view are entirely described accurately and photographed honestly. There were no surprises. It's an eco friendly unit so be prepared to open windows and turn fans on when you arrive to sleep comfortable. Some screens double check to avoid any bugs flying in. Perhaps bug spray should be a recommendation?

Get some veggies and cook in. The kitchen is great with an amazing view!

We had a terrific stay at the Lodge. It was the perfect place to relax on the quiet North Shore. Acai Bowls at the Crispy Grindz truck at the foot of the driveway were delicious, as was the Thai food at the Elephant Truck next door.
Nice spot.  Porch view is wonderful.  Only had time for one day.  Wish we could have stayed more.
Simply amazing.Tons of character. tranquil. Pictures don't lie - thank you for sharing this treasure.

I cannot say enough about how great this place was… The overall experience location and vibe that the farm has is amazing and it was really great to experience it for a month. Very clean very well thought out, and most of all, super comfortable in a great place to call your home away from home. Super attentive thoughtful and respectful hosts as well, I can't wait to go back.

North Shore is a paradise on Earth and this lodge is one of the best spots to enjoy it. The view is amazing and it was just lovely to have breakfast in the early morning watchin the ocean from the balcony.

The apartment was big and well furnished (especially the kitchen although we never got to use it) and located just a few minutes walk away from the beach. There are shops and food trucks nearby as well and most of the main attractions in the area can be reached in minutes by car.

For those afraid of bugs (like my wife), the house is clean and there are screens at every window so we didn't see any in almost 4 days although the house is located among trees at the foot of a hill. You'll have definitely some geckos as guests on the ceiling every now and then but you'd barely notice them (my wife gave a name to each one of them, the little ones are George and Fred :D).

Unfortunately I didn't get to meet Meleana, although she's been always very quick to reply to my messages and she helped us a lot by storing our luggage all day after check-out so we could enjoy North Shore until the evening before our late night flight. 

Definitely reccomended!

My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay very much. The location in unbeatable and the lodge offers everything you could need. Thanks for letting us stay!
Laura & Jae

I found the place more or less as described in the listing, though there were a few minor exceptions worth mentioning. I didn't meet or speak with the Maleana (host), though she did respond to my emails and texts. The space includes the upstairs unit but it is connected to the downstairs unit which is occupied by another tenant.
Although there was a ceiling fan in the kitchen and bathroom, the humidity and heat was exceptionally high during at night and not having any air conditioning kept me awake most of the night.
I was rather disappointed in the cleanliness of the place - there were insects and small lizards inside the house and fecal matter on the inside window sills which I spent some time cleaning off.  I had no cell service (TMobile) and the wifi was very weak/slow.  
To be fair, waking up in the bedroom in the morning I had the real feeling like I was inside the jungle - lush plants surrounding screen windows.  This created a real feeling of escape and remoteness which I loved.
All in all, for the $500 I paid for 2 nights stay, I thought I could have gotten a better overall experience staying at a real hotel.
Great location, great view, host stopped by to make sure everything was OK. Enjoyed our stay.

We had an amazing time at the Lodge, it's perfectly situated for exploring the north shore and has incredible views. 

Great food vans and Teds bakery are nearby, all worth a visit. The place was comfortable,  had great wifi cooker, fridge etc. We would certainly book again!

Thanks for having us!

The Lodge was fantastic - the location was perfect (about a 5 minute drive to the beach), with a beautiful lanai, lots of windows and a quiet, peaceful farm/jungle setting. The photos of the lodge are accurate - it's rustic and spacious, with a well equipped kitchen. 

Fans keep you semi-cool at night and screens keep *most* of the critters out (the millipedes are tiny and harmless and the geckos eat mosquitos + roaches...which may be why they're considered a 'lucky charm' in Hawaii). If you're after a sterile/super clean hotel type environment, then this lodge may not be for you. But if you're excited for a true Hawaiian country experience, then this place is perfect. 

The mattress comfort leaves something to be desired, but you should be up early doing stuff anyways. Overall we definitely felt we got great value for $ spent.

A few additional comments/tips:
- Check surf conditions if you're looking for a place to swim (the surf in this area can pound you).
- The shared WIFI connection was speedy enough for us to watch "The Hawaiian" (a documentary about Eddie Aikau) on Netflix before checking out Waimea Bay. 
- Try pie @ Ted's Bakery (down the road).
- The food trucks down the street are great - especially the Thai.
- Sunset @ Sunset Beach is beautiful.
- Bring a mosquito coil if you want to use the Lanai in the evening.
- If the neighbour's farm cat is still a regular visitor give her a pat from us...we named (her) Felix. She's sweet.

This was an amazing beautiful and quiet location near pipeline.  Stunning views.  Loved the indoor outdoor flow and the spacious kitchen and lounge.  The host and her family looked after us very well.  Would definitely stay here again. WIFI connection was brilliant.  

Just one minor issue the house is not 100% bug proof despite the screens, so recommend bringing some mosquito repellent.
Two friends and I stayed at the pipeline house for three nights, surfing and exploring the north shore. It is a great location with truly epic views.

Awesome location, Banzai Pipeline beach just a walk across the road. The property is charming and peaceful- wish we had more time to explore the farm itself. Enjoyed the view from the lanai, lush greenery around the lodge, and even the geckos (sign of good luck) in the evenings! There were also two friendly cats that greeted us everyday :) Will definitely stay here next time I'm in North Shore. Overall great experience!
Meleana's place is amazing! Absolutely loved it - would definitely stay again the next time I'm in the North Shore. Pictures don't do this amazing space justice. THANK YOU!

We had a wonderful time at Meleana's place!  Perfect location, great views and awesome living space and kitchen.  The North Shore is the place to go when visiting Oahu and Meleana's is the place to stay if you want to absorb what the North Shore has to offer.  The locals within the farm were super helpful and attentive to our needs.  Also, everyone in town knows and has nothing but great things to say about Meleana!

Meleana hat sich schon früh bei uns gemeldet und nach Wünschen und Plänen nachgefragt.
Der Kontakt was sehr herzlich und total unkompliziert.
Die Unterkunft war riesig und sehr gut ausgestattet.

We stayed at Meleana's place on our first trip to Hawaii (Oahu) and being so close to the ocean on the North Shore was the perfect way to spend 4 days. 

The house is exactly is it is in the photographs, however the view has to be seen in all its glory as it is spectacular. Location wise, it is perfectly positioned to cruise up and down the North Shore and only an hour to Waikiki. All of the locals on the farm were informative and friendly and Charlie the cat was nice to have around!!

I would massively recommend Meleana's place to anyone considering a trip to the North Shore.

The property was amazing and extremely clean considering we were surrounded by nature and farmland. It is quiet and tranquil - everything we needed for this leg of our trip.  The view was beautiful and it was a short easy walk to an amazing beach.  Meleana was very responsive and easy to work with.  We will definitely be back
Majestic place that appeared out of the trees on the mountain side. Great place to unwind and just wake up to the ocean views.

Nice accommodation for a couple and views to ocean settled back into woods. Hosts were easy to work with and never around (although close by). Access to fresh veggies farm and eggs was great. Friendliest cat.

No AC and being backed up to woods made a bit warm and more humid but with fans great.

Kitchen well stocked, washer and dryer.

Lizards for fly and mosquito control welcomed and cat for lizards made for a nice ecosystem
This place is awesome!! Very authentic Kama'aina feel.
Amazing space and location. Food and beaches were super close by

The house could be very nice but maybe for a couple. 
There is no much attention to details and cleaning: the blanquets are dirty and so are glasses, the outdoor table, the kitchen sponge are used and old. The fridge and the dishwasher have a bad smell. 

We rented other houses in Hawaii with AirBnB and all of them were very big, with two bedroom and clean for the same price. 

The place of is beautiful but we found very uncomfortable the impossibility to easy talk with our host.

This place holds a little piece of my heart! Never has a place made me feel so relaxed, with the bedroom amongst the trees. Stunning views, plenty of space, thoughtfully decorated, and close to everything you need (it's best if you have a car though). Hopefully we can come back in the future!
This place was a beautiful jungle cabin with the best view around!  Very quiet, calm and peaceful.
the perfect spot...

Located on the quiet side of the island; away from most main touristy attractions, North Shore is beautiful and perfect for a relaxing get away! The view from the lodge is one not to be taken for granted. My husband and I spent time on every part of the island and regardless of the length of the drive; 45 minute max, it was a beautiful one! We enjoyed our stay and Charlie's company, the girl cat that hangs about. :) We would recommend to friends.

Meleana's place was an absolute delight to stay in if you want to really feel like you're getting a local feel for the north shore way of life and only have a short amount of time. Only a few minutes walk to Pipeline and food trucks ect a short drive away.  You could easily stay here, turn your phone off and become unreachable for a few days, but also has the added advantage of Wifi and the TV in case you want the creature comforts.  Meleana was great with communication and next time we come to Hawaii we'll definitely be checking the available dates for this place before we book the flights to make sure we can stay here again.

Meleana's pipeline lodge was fantastic. The space is simple and lovely, and appears just as advertised. We didn't have problems with bugs in the house as some people said. You might want to light some citronella candles on the porch, but that's about all it takes. The farm property is beautiful and everyone was very welcoming. Meleana was a responsive host and made sure that any minor difficulties were taken care of. We will definitely stay at this place again!

Beautiful view, close to the Pipeline beach.  The house is large and the kitchen has everything you need.  
The only problem is the security is not as good as it could be.  The lower unit has access to the upper unit. However, the farm has a lot of staff around.
Beautiful north shore house with a very scenic view! Great place to stay!

Location and accommodations met our expectations. There's a very friendly kitty cat who added a nice welcome. Setting is peaceful and private, with a lovely view. Good proximity to beaches, local attractions (Waimea Valley)  and dining (Ted's Bakery). Highly recommend taking the farm tour -- the work done at the property is fascinating.
Gorgeous view of the ocean, the place is tucked back up on a hillside. Well stocked kitchen and amazing deck. Would have loved to stay longer.

Awesome spot! It feels secluded yet It's few minutes walk from Pipeline. The farm is awesome as well, we got some produce while we were there. The view is incredible and we enjoyed cooking in every night and watching the surf from the lanai 
Mahalo for a great stay!

I must say, we really grew to love this place.  It's rustic, intimate and one-of-a-kind.

It gets 4 out of 5 stars for the following reasons: 

1. I'm not freaked out by the bugs that we found (i.e. dead cockroach by bed, millipedes, mosquitoes) but somebody who wasn't a fan of them, may find this place a little too crowded for their taste. 
Because the house is tucked back into the jungle, it's humid and I think that makes the smell of glasses and the fridge a little ripe.  

2. Our host didn't have the Wifi up and running for the first two days, due to an unpaid bill which made it difficult to communicate and plan our days ahead.  She was apologetic and got it working on day 2.

3. Definitely need a car or other mode of transportation if you plan on doing more than just hitting the beach.

The view at Pipeline Lodge could not be beaten!! A little bit of love would have this place as a five star resort. On the downside there were several holes in the fly screens which let a lot of bugs in, and being set back into the bush, there were a lot of bugs. But all in all it was in a great spot, close to beaches and food trucks and more than we could have hoped for for our honeymoon. Thank you Meleana

We had a lovely stay at the lodge! It was in a great location in the North shore, and in a beautiful green setting. It was a quick drive to supermarkets, food trucks, and popular areas such as Shark's Cove, and it was just a short walk to a lovely beach across the road from the property, where I recommend spending a sunset. The top floor has an spacious deck with a gorgeous view, and the kitchen has everything you need to prepare meals. Also there is a very cute and friendly cat who kept us company! Some amenities listed in the description were not available as far as I could tell(tv/dvds/bikes/snorkel equipment). Not a huge deal for us - no tv meant I read more of my book! - but I mention it in case these are important factors for others when booking. If you are after luxurious accommodation this may not be for you, but for a simple homey feel with plenty of space I think it is good value! The view and enjoying our morning coffee on the deck were the highlight for us.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Overall, it was a good experience and the view is amazing. 

However, there were a few things about the place we think should be communicated to other guests. Honestly, these were not show stoppers for us, but you should know what you're getting into before you book.

1) Some of the wine glasses were dirty and we had to clean some of the dishes to use them. The place wasn't dirty, but we kept finding kitchen items that needed cleaned before using them.

2) There were some holes in the screens and under the doors, so bugs and lizards could move in and out of the lodge easily. We cleaned up all dishes and food after each use to reduce the amount of bugs, which helped, but bugs and lizards all over the place inside the lodge are inevitable.

3) The description states there are pets on the property, but it does not explain how much the pet (cat) is around. We couldn't enjoy the patio without the cat trying to climb on the table or our laps. It was sweet and cute, but annoying. Also, the cat broke into the lodge through a screen on our last day and every time we put it outside it would come back inside and try to jump on the bed. Again, nice cat but neither one of us wanted it playing in our suitcases or bed.

4) Owner was responsive but a little slow to multiple attempts to ask about the farm fresh produce basket. The description makes it sound like those produce baskets are readily available and they are not...if we would have known that we had to order these in advance, we would have done that because we were pretty excited to try it and support local farms.

I rented the farmhouse apartment for two girlfriends as my family and I stayed in Meleana's other beach front pipeline house, just a block away. They loved it, and invited us over for cocktails on the wonderful large porch with a gorgeous view of the ocean. the kitchen is great with a large center island perfect for cooking and entertaining. you can't beat the ability to buy farm fresh produce right from your front yard :) Everyone was so nice, and my friends loved their stay so much. Thank you, Meleana!
We absolutely loved it!

Had a lovely time staying at Meleana's place on the North Shore. The balcony had an amazing view and we really enjoyed cooking a barbeque in the evenings. The bugs weren't an issue for us. Meleana was super friendly and helpful (thanks for the tidepool tip!!) and we liked the cat visiting us! It reminded us of home. There were a couple of minor issues. Firstly the roosters crow all night so bring your earplugs. Secondly, there was no way of locking the house. Even though it is very safe it made us a bit uncomfortable to have our passports in the house unprotected. If we lost them it would be a major drama. If the bedroom door could be fixed so it locked that would be a great option. Had a lovely stay and really enjoyed the North Shore.
Awesome getaway from town. Love the north shore!

This is a beautiful place to stay! Incredible view, walkable to the beach and close to food trucks. The new appliances in the kitchen are great. It’s right by a nature preserve, so surrounded by lush greenery! We had a great time.

The lodge is a great value considering the location, view, space, cleanliness and amenities. It felt like being in a retreat. I was pleasantly surprised at how spacious it is - big full kitchen, big living room, big deck with a view of Pipeline. Fast wifi and cable TV were also a treat. I was able to work online and watch TV without any problems.

One thing to keep in mind is the check-in. I highly recommend arriving during daylight hours. That was my original plan, but my schedule got messed up and I ended up arriving right after dusk. That combined with somewhat confusing directions led to my going to 4 different places on the dirt road leading to he lodge before I finally found it. There is no cell phone signal, so I couldn't call the host. Fortunately, at 2 of the places I stopped, there were people to point me in the right direction. 

Meleana's lodge is a gem. I would've given it 5 stars if it weren't for my challenging check-in and my messages to the host going unanswered.

If you're looking for a true taste of life on the slow-paced North Shore, we highly recommend booking this home. With elevated views over the ocean, ample space inside, fully-equipped kitchen and classic but super tidy Hawaiian styling. Take advantage of the local farmer's market stalls in the area (we missed Meleana's farm market at the bottom of the road, unfortunately) and local tips provided in her directory. The resident cat was extremely friendly, which we didn't mind. Thanks for having us, just wish we could have stayed longer!
Made our weekend happy! She is friendly, flexible and reliable! Would love to book her place again.

Location was great but we had to leave early due to flying cockroaches, in addition to lizards and other bugs. Not idea for a romantic stay but if you are cool with little guests then this is a great find for the location and price.

Wow! To say we enjoyed our stay is a massive understatement. It was glorious. The peace and serenity, the view...unparalleled. We had the feeling of being completely alone in a rainforest yet in close proximity to the beaches, cafes, grocery, etc. in just 2-3 minutes time. Our bed was incredibly comfortable and the bedding stayed feeling and smelling as fresh as if it were just pulled from the wash. Mele either has magic detergent or maybe it is from being line-dried with the freshest island air possible? We came in celebration of our 22nd anniversary. We wanted a place that appealed equally to us both as my husband is an avid surfer and prefers oceanfront, whereas I love the ocean but prefer privacy and nature as well. This couldn't have matched better if we had designed it ouselves. Many oceanfront homes along the best surf spots must contend with the sounds of the road as well.  Here we somehow only heard ocean and nature even with the road in between. Magical! I poured over the reviews before booking this and have to chuckle at some that I read after experiencing it. Will you hear roosters? Sure- it is Hawaii and they are abundant. Someone suggested bringing earplugs. It would be almost criminal to plug your ears from the sound of the oceans waves rolling in while simultaneously hearing birds chirp and an occasional rooster crow. It was an experience I hadn't been lucky enough to yet stumble upon and we have lived in 7 different states and traveled frequently. I have one hesitance in writing such a positive review and it is that more people may book and it would be harder to get into next time. Mahalo Mele and family!

Meleana's spot is stunning and I really look forward to staying here in the future. If you need to contact her she's very reliable and super quick to respond. She has many tips and recommendations for local spots and adventures. Very clean and accommodating!!!! If You don't book this spot, you're a fool. Just saying.
very relaxing with amazing views. The space was very private but close to all amenities and a fantastic beach

We loved the open layout of the upstairs, and great, well-stocked kitchen. The deck and view is fantastic! As others have mentioned, it can get a little warm in the evenings (though the ceiling fans do a great job), and bugs and little lizards are around. We found that leaving a small light on in the kitchen kept them away from the bedroom during the evening. Overall, expect a cottage-like experience and you won't be disappointed. 

Charlie, the resident cat, is very affectionate. We had to pick up a bag of food for him the first night as he was desperate for something to eat.
View is amazing! Would definitely recommend.

Lovely plantation cabin on the mountain side of North Shore. Easy drive to good swimming, surfing, and snorkeling. Not as secluded as the pictures imply; there are other tenants (including a woman who walks around wearing nothing but flip flops and a hat) on the property so not as quiet/private as you might expect. Nice to be out a way from Haleiwa but serious traffic on the coastal road so budget lots of time for the grocery run.

Meleana's place is even more beautiful than the pictures do it justice, waking up to a view of the ocean and the trees right in your living room really can't be beat. It's a 25 minute walk to shark's cove, or maybe less if you're a fast walker. There was some of the best snorkeling you can find on the island, if not the best, and was definitely a highlight of our trip. On top of the sunset Beach is across the street and is one of the most beautiful beaches you'll see, right in your front yard practically! Meleana was very quick to respond and couldn't have been more accommodating with her recommendations and suggestions. Some people said there are a lot of bugs, though, I'll be honest, I didn't really see any inside the home aside from the occasional gnat or moth, but it is Hawaii and you are in the country so to speak, so it really wasn't an issue at all. All in all, I'd highly recommend this spot if you're planning on visiting Oahu.

The location of this place on a hill overlooking to beach is incredible. Probably the best sunset viewing deck I've ever set foot on! It is also super comfortable with a fully equipped kitchen and a great Hawaiian-style interior. The fresh produce from the farm was delicious. Highly recommended!

We had an amazing time there. Such a great place. Stylish and comfortable. 
Great balcony, sunset view, furnished, bbq available.
Supermarket / food trucks / shark's cove are just 1 mile away or so.
Wish I could have stayed longer.
Un endroit magique
Great location. Amazing views. Simple amenities - all you really need at the beach. The bed is a double so if you’re tall, your toes may hang off the end but other than that it’s a great spot
The farm is so cool!  Right across from Pipeline and the whole family is great!  There was a fun potluck and blue grass jame while I was there.  Amazing!!!

Great location on the pipeline on a cool eco farm. Super close to sharks cove and Ted's bakery. Def go check out the bakery. Nice house cat who likes to come visit and snuggle. Full kitchen so you can cook and chill and enjoy a great sunset from the beach or porch either way!

This was our second time staying at Meleana's place.  We absolutely love staying there.  It was so hard to leave to head home.  We especially enjoyed the rural setting, the location, the privacy, spaciousness of the living area and deck and the gorgeous view.    We so much enjoyed the tropical plants and birds, seemed like a paradise.   A simple walk to the beach.  Excited to go again!

Location is just as described. It’s a wet tropical climate—so buggy during rainy season, but if you keep the doors closed the mosquitoes are limited inside. It’s just a quick hike down the hill to Pipeline and amazing surf if you enjoy a good beach for surf watching, sunrise/sunset walks or just chilling with a good book, as there are relatively few people around. (Not a swimming beach or good for kids—in the water as the surf is big and there is a current that runs along the shoreline.) The lodge house overlooks the working farm and the produce that is in season is available for purchase—so take advantage of fresh veggies and fruit. Unit is well stocked with amenities and all the folks who work on/around the farm are very friendly. Overall lovely visit and very friendly owner/family and all the friends around. Thank you Mele, Carol and Stacy for your friendly hospitality.
Gorgeous place, perfect location. Loved every minute in this special spot.

My husband and I enjoyed the Pipeline Lodge/Waihueana so much we're already talking about staying there again next time we're back on Oahu. We loved the views over the farm and the ocean beyond from the deck; the beautiful jungle backdrop outside the bedroom window; the 5-minute walk down the hill to Pipeline; the convenience of being just a few minutes drive away from Pupukea and Waimea Bay  in one direction and Kahuku and Malaekahana in the other; the assortment of organic produce we bought at the Waihuena farm stand and the lodge's ample kitchen and big gas grill. We also really appreciated the ceiling fans in the bedroom, living room, and kitchen -- in addition to the breeze coming through from the deck, these kept the house airy and comfortable. Windows were well screened, keeping the mosquitoes outside. WiFi was great and there was a good desk for working. Meleana, Stacy, and everyone we met at the farm made us feel welcomed.

Perfect Location
Beautiful Jungle-Appartment
Amazing Terrace
Lovely Cat
Cool Bicycles
Friendly Dad

We had a great stay. Loved the view and just how relaxing it was to sit up above everything and enjoy. Very quiet and peaceful. It is a bit of a walk to the beach but we booked it expecting that. We enjoy getting out and walking. There was a trailhead just on the other side of the school that we were able walk to also. 
Plenty of food carts within a short drive that we enjoyed. Our stay was so short we didn’t cook in much. 
Overall we enjoyed our stay here.

The house is beautiful, especially wirh it's view and surrounding! It is very central and close to Hanalei and a lot of beaches. It's stuffed with everything you need an you have a very large kitchen, where you can cook all togehter! If you love nature, then it's the place to be :)

The place was in an amazing location and the oceanview from the terrace is beautiful. The feeling of being in the jungle was nice but very humid. There was no windows in the room and that made our bed almost wet all day long. Also the couch not very comfy. Amazing kitchen with an open view and nice to cook and eat around the big table. 
It was a bit cold at night and the downstairs door was open all the time what made the cat, mosquitos and other animals come in the house. The cat was lovely. Amazing laundry area and outside shower! Thanks for everything! We felt it was overpriced but had a beautiful stay.
Location is unreal for anyone that surfs across from pipeline! No AC a bit damp when it rains so feels a bit like glamping but hey your in Oahu. Host is chill and responsive.

There was a lot of liked about this property. The kitchen is magnificent for cooking. It’s  large and spacious and well stocked and I love that it has a joint living space. Very open and livable. Some things I didn’t love so much were the screens.  The desperately  need changing.. some are held in by tape and bugs come in. Also, they were out of mosquito coils and I got badly eaten. When I asked the host about it she told me to goto the store and buy some bc she wouldn’t be able to do it. I understand people get busy but it would have been nice to at least be greeted when we arrived. I never actually met the host just the housekeeper when we showed up to check it a bit early and it wasn’t ready. When I asked about a little later checkout she was kind of rude over text. Also, the shower head is a step above a hose spicket.
 Once I bought more coils I could enjoy the home more even though it felt like I was camping. And the SWEETEST kitty comes and visits . I tried to text the host for his/her name but she never responded.

Very charming!! My 14 year old son and I booked a last min trip to Oahu without any reservation. We knew we wanted to stay around the north shore for a few days. I requested the reservations 2 hour before dark for 2 nights.  Meleana responded within mins which was wonderful. I wish I had read her check in instruction. which stated every detail on how to get to the farm house from the main road because we completely lost reception a few blocks away.  No worry’s we just came back to the main highway and call meleana she was happy to give us direction back up. Right before we arrived we stopped at foodland just 1mile away for a few breakfast items for the next morning. The kitchen was well  equipped with a beautiful view of the ocean, very nice pans and a Vitamix for your smoothly lovers out there!!  Meleana did let us know about the  mosquitoes since we were a couple blocks inland. The first night no bites, going into the second night after it rained a few came out which we didnt mind since we were coming in and out the front porch.  My son and I wanted to  experience Oahu without our normal resort vacations. Saying at the farmhouse absolutely made us feel like I was living here for years. We will be definitely back with more friends and family

Amazing view high over the beach from the deck and tree house like feel from large windows in the bedroom. It is like opening you eyes to the jungle. Great amenities in the kitchen for those that want to cook - Vitamix, rice cooker, french press, solid pots and pans, decent knives as well. We would come back.
A very pleasant stay. Quiet peaceful, with some incredible views. Close to the best places on the North Shore, the best area of Oahu. We would recommend this place to others.

Great view in a secluded area.  Close to Haleiwa, excellent food trucks and their own farmer's market on Mondays.  Unit sits above a working organic farm...the breezes were a little chilly due to the many screens throughout the house, but very tolerable and made us feel like we were staying in the jungle.  Great, well equipped kitchen and large dining/living area with an expansive BBQ/Lanai area.  Awesome, very friendly and talkative kitty...Hi Charlie!  Good Value for a very nice stay!

name: 鄰近香港城市大學､地下列車站,交通便捷｡雙人房,上下層床｡歡迎月租或年租｡長期租住月租五折｡
summary: 整潔､清静､往返機場巴士站约步行10分鐘路程,交通便捷,治安良好｡大廈有升降機,平地lift.距離香港城市大学步行约15分鐘,專線綠色小巴约5分鐘車程｡鄰近地鉄車站,剩坐地鐵列車两分鐘到達｡宿舍有两間獨立的房間,每房間可住两人｡歡迎旅遊或大學交換生長租或短住｡
description: 整潔､清静､往返機場巴士站约步行10分鐘路程,交通便捷,治安良好｡大廈有升降機,平地lift.距離香港城市大学步行约15分鐘,專線綠色小巴约5分鐘車程｡鄰近地鉄車站,剩坐地鐵列車两分鐘到達｡宿舍有两間獨立的房間,每房間可住两人｡歡迎旅遊或大學交換生長租或短住｡
house_rules: 住宿期間,請勿接待異性訪客到訪或逗留｡要細心處理煮食的問題,因為沒有煮食的環境,沒有厨房,只可作簡單的煮食｡

reviews.comments: The reservation was canceled 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The reservation was canceled 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
It's a small but comfortable place to live! The Landlord is super kind and helpful.
多谢ken,一位非常靠谱的老板!You're a Good Man ｡

Para llegar a la ubicación desde CityU es necesario tomar el MTR o autobús. La zona es mayormente residencial y, como en todos lados, es mejor no andar fuera a altas horas de la noche.  Cerca hay un Subway, un super mercado "Wellcome", panadería, lavandería, escuelas.

El alojamiento es confortable, muy limpio; tiene aire acondicionado y refrigerador. Además el señor se preocupa por tener bebidas de cortesía (refresco, jugos).  Hay tetera también.  

Me resultó complicado el uso del Internet porque es proporcionado vía un celular Windows Phone que al paso del tiempo entra en reposo. Además fue necesario cambiarlo de chino a inglés para poder compartirlo con mis dispositivos. Cabe señalar que el señor Ken no está todo el día en el lugar; dado que mi celular no funcionó en Hong Kong sin internet era imposible localizarlo o reportar alguna situación. Además no toda la gente en Hong Kong habla inglés.

香港的房子都不大,不过房间非常整洁,客厅有两排书桌可以学习,冰箱里的可乐可以免费喝｡位置也非常好,出去直走就是深水埗地铁站了,可以直达尖沙咀｡房东先生非常nice,让我不要客气,去地铁站接我｡约定的时间我还没到,房东先生还怕我迷路｡把我安置好就回去了,说第二天把钥匙留下就可直接离开｡对住客非常放心｡照顾我是内地人虽然有点吃力但一直在和我讲普通话｡隔壁房间也是从台湾来的两名女同学｡总之这次入住非常满意｡
房東是一位很友善,很客氣的老先生｡多次給我聯繫,怕我迷路｡親自到地鐵站來迎接我,還特意帶我轉了周圍的環境,介紹了周邊便利店,吃飯,超市,買水果的地方｡房間雖不大,但是打掃的很乾淨｡交通也很便利,樓下就有BUS站,稍微走幾分鐘就有地鐵!
地點是可以的,房間和客廳都有窗,光線和通風不錯｡
謝謝房東願意臨時接受我們的申請入住,離地鐵很近,周邊很多好吃的食物❤️ 真的很謝謝你

衛生做的特別好,無論是洗手間或是房間內｡房東人也很棒,當天晚上很早就等在屋內給我們開門,告訴我們如何開鎖匙｡並且房東應該是非常熱心的人,像是有教小孩子中文的課程｡
房間就是一般香港房子的大小,床墊和被子很軟很舒服,上下鋪一晃會有點抖動可能是因為我和媽媽睡眠質量不太好的關係｡
性價比在這個地段以及時間算是很好了｡
其他遜色的方面在於WIFI壞了幾天,房間的隔音效果不是很好,因為鋁製門的關係天窗還會透出客廳的光,如果另一間房的人開著燈或是講話會有點打擾到｡
另外一些日用品需要自己準備,熱水壺､冰箱､轉換插頭會有提供｡
大伯是个很好的人 会说普通话沟通没什么障碍 房间很干净
Ken是个很好的房东!从预约开始就一直联系我为我提供帮助｡住的地方干净整洁,感觉比图片描述还要好一些｡这次一个人去没有带太多行李,觉得房间也不算窄｡有饮用的热水提供｡美中不足的是洗澡时的热水有些不稳定｡总体而言是很不错的体验｡
房间很干净,虽然不大,但是我一个人住在香港寸土寸金的地方也算不错了｡从机场到家坐巴士E21,房东亲自在巴士站接我｡由于要使用的钥匙有4把,我没太记清楚操作过程,把其中一把钥匙给拧弯了,房东最后没有收我的钱,给他添麻烦了,谢谢!
房间有点点小,但很干净｡ken来地铁站接的我们,还带我们买电话卡,和我们介绍环境,带我们认路｡非常谢谢
非常整洁,离地铁近,很方便,ken特别热情,招待非常好
Ken is so so nice and friendly. The room is super clean and tidy. Location is convenient and close to MTR. Would recommend to my friend if they visit HK:)
Ken fut un hôte bienveillant qui nous a accueillit et guidé avec une générosité. La chambre est petite mais la literie confortable.
非常热心的一个房东,很好的一次体验｡
房子交通很方便,整洁,安全,虽然小但是对短途旅行来说已足够｡热水在我们居住期间没有问题｡ken很热心,我朋友找不到机场大巴上车的位置,ken还送她去坐车｡
房子的性价比很高,离地铁很近,Ken先生服务态度一流,非常耐心地帮我们指路,又是一位敬畏上帝的人,值得推荐｡

房东和蔼可亲

非常好,交通方便,环境干净,房东人也很好｡
房东Ken非常热情,人很好,我们比预计时间晚了一个小时到,Ken很早就等在地铁站接我们｡房间很小,但香港都这样,这个价位非常实惠｡周围晚上车辆声音会比较大,但相较于尖沙咀重庆大厦应该已经好很多了｡深水埗吃的很多很正宗,步行5分钟内有很多地道港茶哦!

name: Lovely balcony flat in central
summary: Balcony apartment in the heart of Hong Kong's  hippest street. The building is a 1950s 2nd floor walk up. The interior is clean, architect designed and renovated in January 2015.
space: This minimalist apartment is a good choice to enjoy hong kong. It is a fully renovated (2015), second floor walk-up  in the heart of Central's art scene. There is a balcony bar overlooking Gough Street and the leafy pedestrian street of Kau U Fong. It is near to the MTR, the Central Escalator, Soho and the amazing Gage Street Market - a good place to entertain.  But the flat is also about privacy and quiet. There is a large white bedroom with total black-out curtains. Pillows are feather. There is WiFi throughout.  Plus a 55" inch Samsung TV (on wheels!)  Decoration is modern minimalist with emphasis on cleanliness and functionality.  There is also a backroom that functions as a study / dining room. If you are coming on business, there is a washing machine and world-class steam iron. Enjoy!
description: Balcony apartment in the heart of Hong Kong's  hippest street. The building is a 1950s 2nd floor walk up. The interior is clean, architect designed and renovated in January 2015. This minimalist apartment is a good choice to enjoy hong kong. It is a fully renovated (2015), second floor walk-up  in the heart of Central's art scene. There is a balcony bar overlooking Gough Street and the leafy pedestrian street of Kau U Fong. It is near to the MTR, the Central Escalator, Soho and the amazing Gage Street Market - a good place to entertain.  But the flat is also about privacy and quiet. There is a large white bedroom with total black-out curtains. Pillows are feather. There is WiFi throughout.  Plus a 55" inch Samsung TV (on wheels!)  Decoration is modern minimalist with emphasis on cleanliness and functionality.  There is also a backroom that functions as a study / dining room. If you are coming on business, there is a washing machine and world-class steam iron. Enjoy! Whole flat Whole pl
neighborhood_overview: This is an amazing and totally safe neighbourhood, where old and new Hong Kong collide in beautiful ways. The area is the heart of hip Hong Kong.  International art galleries, restaurants and bars abound, Yet historic Hong Kong is everywhere. The apartment is built on the site where Sun Yat Sen planned China's revolution in 1898. Across the road is one if the city's most loved noodle shops (US$5 a bowl). Next door is one of HKs last outdoor cafes (Toast and condensed milk, US$2). Next street is Gage Street market, a photographers paradise. One street up is Hollywood Road and PMQ - the Art Heart. Then, there is Soho, Noho, Sheung Wan and Lan Kwai Fong all just five minutes stumble away.
notes: World class steam iron makes ironing actually fun.
transit: Its in Central. Everything is near.  MTR (Mass Transit Railway) 5 mins walk. Central mid levels Escalator 4 mins walk Star Ferry 15 minutes walk.  Quiet street at night Taxis 24 hour always running from Aberdeen Street (1 mins walk) No parking. But taxi will drop you home at the door.
access: Whole flat
interaction: Whole place to yourself.
house_rules: Smoking only on balcony.

host.host_about:
I am a British writer who divides time between Hong Kong (where I run a magazine company) and Bali (where my family live). 

I love Hong Kong.

address.street: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: Great experience right from the start. Tom was very welcoming and showed me around the apartment. The apartment was in amazing condition and in a very good location. Very comfortable bed and great balcony overlooking the street. Very spacious and modern. Would most definitely stay here again!

Tom's place is great in terms of location: walking distance from Hong Kong station (connects to airport and in-city luggage check-in) and Central station. There are many little galleries, lifestyle/interior stores, intriguing boutiques and even candy stores to explore around his place (tips: you can leave your shopping bags at home and hit the streets again). It is also very close to famous noodle restaurants in Wellington St, and just opposite a popular beef noodles restaurant. 

I like it that Tom's place is really quiet and calm at night, great for having a beer on the balcony, and watching movies on his HUGE TV (Tom's got some really cool movies). His place is also very tasteful, minimalist and spacious, so for this price, beats ANY tiny Hong Kong hotels in Hong Kong Island or Kowloon area. And Tom was not joking about his world class steam iron.

My only regret is not being able to meet Tom in person as i was late and made some bad transport decisions. It is best to walk to Tom's house if you do not have that much luggage, as traffic jams + narrow roads + other tourists lining up for taxis can cause tremendous delay.

Had a lovely time staying seven nights in this conveniently-located flat.  Tom provided us with several large bottles of juice, as well as some soda, iced coffee, etc., which I thought was a nice surprise! The washing machine was very useful and the flat was quite modern and well-kept, in general. Would stay again and recommend to anyone!

Everything was more than perfect. The apt exceeded our expectations and was more impressive than the listing description. The location was amazing, everything was easily accessible. The apt itself was clean modern and incredibly comfortable. Tom was easy to communicate with and very generous.

Would love to stay here again when I'm next in town!

We had a fantastic stay at Tom's apartment, we couldn't have asked for anything more as was already supplied with the essentials.  The apartment was spacious with a great kitchen, bathroom and computer/laundry area.  The bed was very comfortable and a large TV with with a great selection of TV shows and movies to choose from.  The balcony was fantastic and used all the time and was great for people watching (especially the queue across the road for the noodle shop) while having your meals or a quick drink before going out and exploring the neighbourhood.  The location was fantastic, great shops and restaurants all around and close to the mid-levels escalators, MTR and ferries.  Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone.

Tom was an excellent host and made us feel extremely welcome, the flat is fantastic and in a great location. A real mix of old and new on the doorstep. Really close to the mtr and the trams and buses. Lots of markets near by and lots of great places to eat on the doorstep. Would love to stay here again.

Tom’s place is in a great location and is very close to several restaurants and bars. There is also a grocery store close by which made life easy, especially with a 12-month-old baby.  His apt was un-expectantly pleasant and was very spacious compared to other Hong Kong apts.  Tom’s helper was very friendly and explained the workings of the apartment. To our surprise she bought our little one milk. See definitely went above and beyond to make us feel at home. The neighbors made noise in the early morning upstairs but the comfort of the bed made you forget about the noise.  All and all a great location and hospitable quarters.
Tom is super host! He is courteous, prompt and kind. His gorgeous place is located in a very good location with access to many amenities, shops and restaurants.

As already mentioned by all the other guests. Tom is a great host! My brother and I had the pleasure to meet him in person when we got to his place, he was extremely welcoming and made us feel at home. The flat is spacious and offers everything we could wish for. And the location is even better, everyone we met confirmed us how lucky we were to stay in this area. The only downside was that some of the best places around where closed because of the lunar new year, so instead of people queuing for the noodle shop downstairs we saw many disappointed faces looking at the closed sign, including us… I guess that is good to know if you are planning to visit Hong Kong. But as you see there isn’t even one downside which is actually related to Tom or the flat. I’d recommend it to a friend without hesitating, this is the place to go :)

Tom was very helpful and responsive to messages.  Flat is very well located and convenient to everything.  Excellent balcony for people watching.  Well stocked in all regards - kitchen, washing/cleaning supplies, movies.  I would definitely come back given the opportunity.

Excellent location being so close to Soho, Lan Kwai Fong and transportations around HK but on a quiet side street. 

The apartment was spacious, comfortable, clean and was exactly as described. 

Good contact prior to arrival and Yuppi (the person who met me and showed me around the apartment) was welcoming and helpful.

Would definitely use again if I am in HK

Fantastic stay in a brilliant apartment. Stayed with my partner in sunny/typhoon season August. We were both comfortable the whole week and pleasantly surprised by just how conveniently close Central, Mid Level escalators and Sheung Wan were. Balcony is great for watching the world go by with a drink. Apartment is spacious, clean and well presented. Lots of toiletries and other items left to make the stay easier. Directly opposite a famous noodle place. Great communication with Tom and Yupi before and during our stay. Really helpful! Couldn't recommend the apartment enough. Thank you!

Tom's communications were great and we found the place quite easily through his directions. He also helped us with a few location enquirie. Maybe the freezer could do with defrosting. Otherwise everything was great. Tom allowed us to check out a little later  Thanks for a great stay
Great place! Super convenient and Tom was very responsive. Would definitely stay there again.

Tom was an excellent host. The apartment was simply perfect for our trip. Great location, right size, excellent distribution of living areas and very clean. Communications during our stay, as well as checking in and out was smooth and efficient. Will repeat stay next time we visit Hong Kong. 10/10.
Tom's flat and the experience of living there are excellent. Everything is exactly the same as described. The best airbnb I've ever have in HK. Would definitely come for next time!
Great place and great host! We would definitely come again. Also many thanks and greetings to yuppy!

Tom's place was in a great location close to restaurants, shopping and bars. The apartment was clean and spacious with an awesome balcony that was great for a pre dinner drink. Our plane arrived early and Tom was super kind to allow us to check in before the regular check in time. Would be happy to stay here again on our next HK trip.
The best about this place is to sit on the open balcony after a long day, overlook the little lane and enjoy the quite atmosphere of Gough Street.

Great location with many bars and restaurants with in walking distance.  Apartment was clean and well equipped with pretty much everything you would need.  Also, supermarket around the corner should you need to pick up anything.  Great alternative to expensive hotels in Central.
great location! so many iconic restaurants (ronin, the chairman, etc.) less than 5 min walk away. Place is spacious for two people and the balcony is super cute.
Good place to stay, close to ifc and central

Tom's flat is absolutely wonderful. It's clean, spacious, and very well located. It's an awesome base for exploring HK as it's close to both MTR and the ferry terminals. Even for food options it's great since it's right next to Kau Kee and Shing Heung Yuen. The balcony gave us a nice place to enjoy a beer after a day of exploring. Overall we feel super lucky to have been able to stay here, and would definitely stay again.
The host canceled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Thanks Tom for your hospitality. Place was neat a tidy and pretty much close to everything or within a short walking distance to public transport.
everything was perfect! thank you, tom!

name: 1 Bedroom Apartment at Hyde Park/Darlinghurst
summary: Sydney CBD - East Sydney - Darlinghurst  Beautiful art deco entire one bedroom apartment in a historic building located on one of the most vibrant streets on the edge of Darlinghurst and Sydney CBD.  Suitable for guests who wants to experience living like an Australian locals but also enjoys the convenience and luxury of living in a walking distance to the city centre.
space: The space is one bedroom apartment with a newly renovated ensuite bathroom. You will have a queen size memory foam bed with clean sheet set and clean towels. Bathroom has been renovated, it has frameless shower with good water pressure, marble counter and build-in washing machine.  The apartment has a high ornate ceiling and French windows and chandeliers. Located in a charming and quiet street of Darlinghurst, and just a minute walk to Hyde Park and museum station, 5 mins to Sydney CBD, 8 min walk to Townhall station.
description: Sydney CBD - East Sydney - Darlinghurst  Beautiful art deco entire one bedroom apartment in a historic building located on one of the most vibrant streets on the edge of Darlinghurst and Sydney CBD.  Suitable for guests who wants to experience living like an Australian locals but also enjoys the convenience and luxury of living in a walking distance to the city centre. The space is one bedroom apartment with a newly renovated ensuite bathroom. You will have a queen size memory foam bed with clean sheet set and clean towels. Bathroom has been renovated, it has frameless shower with good water pressure, marble counter and build-in washing machine.  The apartment has a high ornate ceiling and French windows and chandeliers. Located in a charming and quiet street of Darlinghurst, and just a minute walk to Hyde Park and museum station, 5 mins to Sydney CBD, 8 min walk to Townhall station. Entire apartment 1 bedroom 1 bathroom, 40 sqm. Suitable for up to 2 people.  Check in 10 am Check out 1
neighborhood_overview: East Sydney suburb is located on the adjacent right side of the CBD, next to Hyde park. It is in a walking distance to surry hills, darlinghurst, woolloomooloo, kingscross and Chinatown. This area is vibrant and has plenty of restaurants, cafes and in a quiet spot. You will get the feel of living in a village in Eastern suburb mixed with Sydney business district.  Down the street (approx 30 metres) there are plenty of trendy cafes, bars and restaurants. Many of them are very reputable and affordable. You will get the feeling of charming and vibrant suburb of Darlinghurst, whereas Sydney CBD is only 5 minutes walk across Hyde Park.  Cook and Philip park aquatic centre (2 minute walk) has heated swimming pool and gym that guests can use for a cheap entry. In adjacent, there is St Marry Cathedral and you can get to the Royal Botanical Garden in less than 10 minute walk. Darlinghurst/Victoria road and Potts Point offer a selection of restaurants, deserts, night life and more.  Bondi beach
notes: Please have at least a formal form of formal verification such as driver license or passport when you arrive.  Please respect neighbours as it is very quiet in this building.
transit: From Airport, take a city circle train to Museum station and walk approximate 2 minutes. The building is located just across the park. If you get off at Central, it will be about 10-12 minute walk and 8 minute walk from Town Hall station. There is a bus stop right outside the building. The bus 389 comes every 10-15 minutes and it will take you to Darling Habour. You can also take this bus in opposite direction to Bondi Beach in just half an hour. At Hyde Park there is a major bus stop that will take you anywhere across Sydney. If you wish to rent a car, there are plenty of car hire companies in the surround area and they offer competitive rates for car hire.  Unfortunately there is no car park in the building, you will need to park on the street but there are always parking right outside the building.
access: Entire apartment 1 bedroom 1 bathroom, 40 sqm. Suitable for up to 2 people.  Check in 10 am Check out 10 am Pls enquire about checkin/out for other times.  You will be provided with fresh towels, bed linens, iron/ironing board, TV, tea and coffee and unlimited fast internet Wifi  etc  There is a build-in washing machine and detergents available in the apartment. Cloth lines and communal dryer on the roof top area are also available. Rooftop deck has amazing view of the city, great to chill out on a sunny day.  Kitchen is fully equipped with all the cooking utensils. It has fridge, gas cook tops, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster etc. The living room is open plan, has a 3 seater couch, 40" TV screen, dining table, and french chandelier.  Smoking is allowed on the rooftop or outside building only. Could potentially be some noises from local school during the day
interaction: I would like you to feel comfortable and have a great time during your stay so please let me know if there is anything I can assist. I will make sure I respond to your message quickly.
house_rules: This building is strictly on fire safety so smoking in the apartment is not permitted. However you can smoke outside the building and on the roof top area. The common rooftop area is open from 7 am to 9 pm. You will not be able to access outside this time. Please treat as your own home and respect neighbours. Party not allowed.  Please keep fly screen closed as there are some insects coming from outside of building.

host.host_about:
Hi my name is Tam, Australian, Thai background who works professionally in cancer therapy field. I am a very easy going and respectful. Whenever I am free I like to watch movies, listen to music, go to gym and just simply catch up with friends for lunch or dinner .. not party often as I used to :-)

My personality trait is shy but I enjoy getting to know new people to broaden my friend networks. I highly value respect and honesty and it think it is a general thing that everyone should be. Personally I am very clean and tidy and expect the same when I have a guess over :-) If you have any questions about myself please feel free to ask :-)

reviews.comments: Tam was the most attentive, considerate and friendly host. The introduction was very comprehensive but also informative and friendly. Tam responds to all questions very quickly. The apartment itself is in an amazingly convenient location and although cosy, is very modern and beautifully decorated.

Tam's apartment was beautifully decorated and very clean & tidy! I was so glad that I chose to stay here overnight on a work trip as it was close to everything with some great restaurants to choose from around the corner.

Thank you Tam, Your room was just as described, I flew in Early and responded right away to my sms about the key location and he made it a hassle free situation. 
Great location for my needs this time in Sydney, walking distance to various neighbourhoods and the city, I didn't need to get one cab in the 3 days there. 
Thanks for a hassle free stay, will look you up again on my next business trip to Sydney.
He let me in at 12 pm. Took care of everything.

Wonderful location close to the city and paddington shops & restaurants. Tams apartment has lots of natural lighting, and is surprisingly quiet given its close proximity to the city.

Tam was easy to deal with and accomodated us last minute, great communicator and made sure we were settled in nicely.

Tam's place is fantastic.  Beautifully decorated and so clean.  The location is excellent, just a short stroll through the park and you're right in the centre of Sydney, Westfield and the main shopping district.

Tam was so helpful and checked in via email to see how I was getting on.  The whole process was a breeze, considering I only booked a few days before travelling.  

Thanks so much for making my stay in Sydney great!

My partner and I was happy staying at Tam's beautiful apartment in Darlinghurst. Tam's description of the space is accurate, and the apartment is, if anything, more beautiful than the photos might suggest. The house was immaculately cleaned and maintained, well equipped in a lovely neighborhood. The location is amazing; Hyde Park is literally 1 min walk from the apt, close to good restaurants, coffee shops, and convenient store. The setting is perfect for a weekend or holiday getaway. Perfect for tourists or when you're on a business trip. 

I didn't get to meet Tam as he was away for holiday. But things were easy! Tam was a terrific host; he responded promptly to my initial query, and once we were there, it seemed that he'd thought of everything. Highly recommended!

Tam is a great host! His place is AMAZING, the room is very comfortable, spacious and clean. The location is great too! The CBD, Circular Quay, Surry Hills are all a short walk away, and buses and trains to Bondi Beach, Newtown and the airport are all within a block of his place. I loved it and will definitely recommend his place to my friends who'll be visiting Sydney.

Tam's place was perfect, offering everything that I needed in the perfect location. 
Very happy with my stay and Tam's communication. Highly recommended !

Tam's apartment is in a great central location close to everything.  He obviously really cares about the aesthetics of his home and everything was clean, in good condition and I felt very comfortable.  Great communication too, made my trip a breeze.  Thank you, will come again.
Great place! Good location, and perfect for 1 traveler. Very quiet building.
Tam's place is very cosy and nice, but the toilet is too small that you're basically stuck between the left wall and the right shower room. Except for that, I think all is good.

Tam's place is a must stay. Located in an area close to restaurants and pubs on a quiet street. The apartment itself was immaculate. Tam thought of everything. The bed was a dream to sleep on, the decor was great and the place smelt amazing. It was light, airy and very clean! I would definitely return to stay if I'm in Sydney again. Tam was an amazing host, very understanding and accomodating when I hit a travel snag. He met me on arrival and showed me around, he also left a detailed guidebook I could refer to.
Really gorgeous place in an ideal location. Dealing with Tam was fast and efficient.

Really nice place to be based to explore Sydney. The apartment is clean, cosy  and attractively funished. It's in a great location where it is a short 7 minute walk to access Museum subway station and the downtown area or buses to Bondi, Cogee and other beaches in the surrounding area. Nearby are a number of food stores and eateries on the lively Liverpool Steet, but the apartment is situated on a not far off quieter street, so it's quite a tranquil area. Tam is a very competent host: communication before and during the stay was first class. Highly recomended.
Everything is good, but there’s a little bugs in the kitchen. Tam is super nice, maybe next time we visit Sydney will choose the same house again!!

Tam’s apartment has everything you could possibly need to make your stay in Sydney feel like you’re staying in your own home. All aspects of the apartment are clean and functional, and there are special touches all over the place that elevate the experience. The location is amazing, so make sure you wander down Stanley street and check out the bars and restaurants while you’re there! 5 stars all the way ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

The apartment was spotlessly clean and comfortable to stay. Tam was so kind and responded promptly for all the questions I had during the stay which made the stay even more comfortable. Bed was really comfy and good pressure of shower was a plus! The apartment was close to cafes and restaurants in Darlinghurst, very close to the city centre and easy walking distance to Museum station - one train from airport. 

I would highly recommend Tam’s place for anyone who is visiting Sydney. I would stay here again when I visit Sydney next time! 

Thank you for your hospitality Tam :)
Tam has been very nice and organised host. The place is very cozy and neat.

Tam’s place is amazing, I really felt as home. The deco it’s very stylish, the location is perfect and the roof top terrace is a must. If possible will definitely repeat his place for my next visit in Sydney. Thanks Tam :-)

I have stayed in many Airbnbs before and always rented the whole apartment or house. This was the first time that I stayed in a place where, from the sheer amount of personal belongings, I had the impression that the apartment is inhabited when not rented out. The result of this is that every cupboard, wardrobe and drawer is full of personal stuff. Not really what I wanted or expected. I do not have a problem with this but it would have been good to know. The photos do paint a good picture of the apartment but what they don't show, and the listing does not clarify, is that this is a ground floor apartment in an old building, with no blinds/curtains, that backs onto an alley way (with bright street lighting) that forms an entrance way into the high school next door. On weekdays, it can be noisy as the kids arrive/depart the school as well as during the break times. 

On a positive note, Tam is a great host and very communicative. He immediately worked to darken the bedroom for me (thanks Tam!) and is very conscientious that his guests are comfortable. The bed is extremely comfortable, towels are soft and fluffy and the location is second to none. The shower is also very good. 

Value for money? This is Sydney and an awesome location but it felt somewhat overpriced.

Cons:
Cluttered, no blinds on windows, ground floor apartment that backs on to school entrance way, pricey

Pros:
Great mattress, shower and towels. Amazing location

Tam is great! Super helpful and responsive, which was much appreciated. Especially when I lost my key 
Great location within a short walk of museum station and some cute restaurants near by. There was also a corner shop for milk etc which was useful. Very easy to get to from the airport. It was nice and clean too. Stanley Street is quite steep with wheelies but made for good exercise!
Great little place. Host was very responsive and the bed was comfy.

name: Gem-like UES writer's studio
summary: Gem-like, art-filled exquisitely-furnished south-facing studio, with exposed brick, high ceilings, garden views, two closets, and a hallway galley kitchen.  Steps from subway.  My personal home -- let only when I'm out of town -- with character to match.
space: This studio is my full-time home and I love it passionately. I rent it only occasionally -- when I'm out of town for work -- to responsible people I hope will love it as much as I do. It's got an ideal layout: a hallway with two (two!) closets, a bathroom with tub, a galley kitchen, and a spacious-feeling south-facing main room, with exposed brick and enough space for entertaining, sleeping, working, and more. The apartment is located in an elevator building on a quiet, historic tree-lined street.
description: Gem-like, art-filled exquisitely-furnished south-facing studio, with exposed brick, high ceilings, garden views, two closets, and a hallway galley kitchen.  Steps from subway.  My personal home -- let only when I'm out of town -- with character to match. This studio is my full-time home and I love it passionately. I rent it only occasionally -- when I'm out of town for work -- to responsible people I hope will love it as much as I do. It's got an ideal layout: a hallway with two (two!) closets, a bathroom with tub, a galley kitchen, and a spacious-feeling south-facing main room, with exposed brick and enough space for entertaining, sleeping, working, and more. The apartment is located in an elevator building on a quiet, historic tree-lined street. The entire apartment is yours. I am happy to clear out at least one closet for you -- negotiable based on the length of your stay. I'll be out of town, but my friend/neighbor will be just around the corner if you need anything! Key pick up an
neighborhood_overview: The Upper East Side has it all. There's the UES of Edith Wharton and Gossip Girl -- the grand museums of Museum Mile, elegant shops, Park Avenue promenades. But Yorkville, where I live, has both easy access to this UES (the m86 is 30 seconds from the apartment), has a bohemian character all its own. Tons of independent bookstores, coffee shops with local poetry reading series, vintage and consignment shopping, great food. One of the few Manhattan neighborhoods to have "mom and pop" shops (you can find a local baker, fishmonger, 3 butchers, and produce shops within a 3-block radius!). One block from Carl Schurz Park and the riverside promenade.
notes: It's a lovely building -- incredibly quiet.
transit: The M86 is a half-block away -- you can look online from home to see when the bus is approaching and still make it out the door in time to get onboard. We're five minutes from the new Q-train which connects you to midtown in 15 minutes or less. The bus connects to all major train lines on the East and West sides, or it's a 5-10 minute walk to the express 4/5 and local 6 trains at 86th street.
access: The entire apartment is yours. I am happy to clear out at least one closet for you -- negotiable based on the length of your stay.
interaction: I'll be out of town, but my friend/neighbor will be just around the corner if you need anything! Key pick up and drop off will be through a 24/7 Keycafé service just around the corner.
house_rules: Absolutely no pets, smoking, 420, etc. This is my home and I'd like to keep it as pristine as I leave it. Couples welcome.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: A journalist based between NYC, Oxford, and the Caucasus.

reviews.comments: I have stayed at many airbnbs, but this was, by far, the best. Not only was Tara incredibly helpful and responsive, her place was even better than depicted. She was out of the country but didn't let that get in the way of still being totally there to provide information and assistance. I would recommend her place on the UES to anyone visiting New York. Five stars out of five!

I very much enjoyed my stay in Isabella's apartment. The location was great, and she was excellent at responding to emails and text messages in a timely manner. I had no worries about check in or out. The flat had everything that I needed, including an elevator (I had a ton of luggage). I'd certainly stay here again.

Tara was a lovely host, her apartment was cosy, neat and 'homey'.
Before we arrived she send us an email with suggestions to good cafes, bars and restaurants in the neighborhood and "quick introduction" to the area. The neighborhood was quiet and safe, close to the water and to central park, with the subway it was easy to go to the city center.
Tara was a very attentive hostess and even that she was in a totally different time zone or traveling, she answered emails and texts quickly and precise. 
I would love to stay here again when/if returning to NYC.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this cozy, central and nice apartment for two weeks while visiting NYC for the first time. 
The combination of feeling at home, which Tara makes sure you do, while being in a new big city, was perfect for us. Tara is truely a great host, who responded to our requests quickly and helped us out with any questions we had. 
The apartment was suitable for two persons and with a small kitchen, it was possible to make some meals at home, making the vacation less expensive. The appartment is a nice walk away from Central Park and not long from a subway station to take you anywhere you want to go. There is several grocery shops nearby too. We have already started planning our next trip to NYC and we will definitely hope that Tara's apartment is available.

Tara is a great host, always helpful and did everything to make our stay pleasant.
Her apartment is small but cozy, and the mini kitchen was very handy. I think my only observation would be that the apartment walls are pretty thin, and the next door neighbors were a bit chatty at night. 
The location is great, a few blocks from the subway and close to many grocery stores and shops, we loved it!
Would definitely stay there again and recommend it, the host and the place are lovely

Great apartment in a decent location,  everything u need is around from bars to grocery,  laundry,  pharmacy etc. Subway and Bus are only minutes away in walking distance. The area it is in is also nice,  especially the Carl Schulz Park which is only 5 minutes away. Host is very responsive and friendly, would always recommend this apartment.

Very nice and comfortable apartment. The host, Tara, gave very clear instructions about the directions around the house. She was very friendly and helpful. She also helped me with advice on eating places etc. She was always available on messages if I ever needed any help. 
The location of the apartment was very nice - lots of eating places nearby, a lovely jogging track by the river 2 blocks away. 

Apartment also had an elevator which helped me avoid lug my suitcase up the stairs. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay there.

Isabella was a great host and her place was great too. She was very accommodating of our arrival schedule and super responsive for our questions. She was also very thoughtful in giving us info we needed for the apartment. Her place is lovely and a great size for a single or couple.

Tara is the best hostess! Very friendly, flexible, easy to reach and get quick response from. She provided very detailed useful practical information! This contributed to make many everyday things work easy for a NYC-rookie as me - and make me feel completely safe and secure during my stay.

The apartment is homey, comfortable and unique. I love the art and brick wall. It had what I needed during my stay - nice light/bright bathroom, kitchen facility, nice big bed, closet/drawer space for my clothing, couch, AC to beat the heat, wifi and (bonus!) loudspeakers to play music.

Yorkville is a very charming neighborhood. East 87th Street is pleasantly quiet, however, near busy streets where you can find good restaurants and grocery stores. I loved charming Carl Schurz Park located by the East River, just two blocks away (Tara's recommendation!). 
I have enjoyed my stay in Tara's home very much! When I come back to New York City (I definitely will) I hope I can rent it again :)

Tara went abroad when I visit her house. But, she told me key-take-point(24-hours diner) near her house by e-mail before I depart to NY. So, I could find keys easily.
I can easily arrive her house from JFK by Uber only $35. I take about 30-minutes.

My sister and I had a great time in NY with a perfect located appartment thanks to Isabella. The place is not extremly spacious but it is convinient and is really nicely decorated. the neighbourhood is quiet and nice, there's some grocery's stores around some pasteries shops, restaurants... everything needed. The subway is close by, and so is central park ! We walked to guggenheim, to the MET and sometimes we went through central park to the city center. I highly recommend Isabella's place to visit NY for few days !
We had a great stay! Thank you!

Ich war mit meiner Tochter für ein ganzes Monat in der Wohnung von Isabella und sie hat vollkommen unseren Vorstellungen entsprochen. Von Anfang an haben wir uns wohl gefühlt.
Bereits vor unserer Ankunft haben wir alle Informationen hinsichtlich Schlüsselabholung, Reinigung der Wäsche, Umgang in der Wohnung, etc.. elektronisch übermittelt bekommen und Isabella hat rasch und umfangreich alle unsere Fragen im Vorfeld abgeklärt. 
Die Wohnung ist zwar klein (1 Schlaf-/Wohnzimmer), aber sehr ruhig gelegen, da sie sich nicht in einer Durchzugsstraße befindet und außerdem in den Innenhof gerichtet ist, wo eine Aussicht auf Bäume besteht.
In der umliegenden Gegend befinden sich viele kostengünstige Lokale für alle Geschmacksrichtungen, auch Supermärkte und Drogerien sind in unmittelbarer Reichweite, was in NY sehr angenehm ist. Die nächste U-Bahn Station ist etwa 10 Gehminuten entfernt.
Durch die Lage in Yorkville sind auch viele Museen leicht zu erreichen und auch der Central Park ist nur etwa 15 min zu Fuß entfernt.

I chose Isabella's place due to the close proximity to the hospital where my mom had knee surgery done.  Her place is exactly as described and shown in the pictures.  She gave me a complete run down on her place and the neighborhood before I arrived via email.  This being my first Airbnb experience I didn't know quite what to expect, but Isabella was always prompt in responding to my various questions and requests.  Her place is accessible to public transportation and and the neighborhood is very safe.  My mom and I stayed there for an extended amount of time and felt like true locals.  I did encounter a problem returning the keys though.  The Keycafe service used for key exchange didn't recognize the fob on the keys and I was stuck there trying to figure it out while I had my mom waiting in a cab with the meter running to go to the airport.  I called the Keycafe customer service number and after 30 minutes was able to get one of the drawers unlocked so I can deposit the keys.  It was stressful start to my journey back home.

Isabella is a great host. She was waiting for us when we got the place. And she's very responsive when I texted her whenever I have questions about the place. I highly recommended Isabella and her lovely apartment.
Cozy and charming. Very convenient with the new Second Ave subway line just two blocks away.
Outstanding. 3 minute walk to new Q Line subway. Elevator in building. A+ communication with host.

We had a great week at Isabella's place. It's a small apartment but does not feel cramped at all. It feels bigger than it looks. We've stayed many times in new York and we were surprised how quiet it was, and heard very little of the noise a big city makes.

The apartment got everything you need. And with the new Q train you can quickly get to midtown and the sights. Central park is close and we walked there several times. Everything you need is also just around the corner being a convenience store, restaurant, bars..

We never got to meet our lovely host but she kept in contact and made sure we had everything we needed. Key pickup and drop-off worked like a charm. Next time I am in New York I am definitely checking first if this apt is available. Great stay!

Great stay here!  The apartment is lovely, quiet, clean and in a great location.  The host is incredibly responsive, even if she is not in the city to meet personally.  Check-in/out process was very easy.

So quiet place! I was surprised that there are no sirens in the nights. 
And you can reach subway station or bus stops under 5 minutes walking. That’s good for city travelers!

Very friendly and good host, help us when we ask about heater.
Apts is ok, central location, easy check in/check out. Slow wifi for us.
I would like a little cleaner.
The host canceled this reservation 37 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Such an amazing stay! Great location and nice on the inside. Tara was a great host and got back to me quickly and efficiently. I highly recommend staying here to anybody looking for a small, clean, cozy, quiet, place to stay when traveling/visiting! I would for sure stay again.

The apartment was exactly as described. Tara was a great host, she answered within minutes and really wanted us to have a perfect stay- which we had.
She also sent us tips for shopping and food which was Herz helpful. 
The location is perfect! 5 minutes away from the subway.

The appartment is very cosy, location is perfect and Tara ia very nice! The place can use some fresh white paint (stains on the wall) some profound cleaning and new sheets. Tara, pls get a new housekeeper and everything will be perfect!! Besides the cleaning it was a great place!!

The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood, close to the subway and to a beautiful park near the river. The 5 floor building is quiet and it has a lift. The apartment has air conditioner (something very important in summer) and it is decorated with elegant details, just like the pictures.
Only I want to warn that is an inhabited apartment so all the host belongings are everywhere. Someone might find this situation a little awkaward. The cleanness in general was ok, but some places needed more attention.
The host was very kind and considerate to me, her responses were every time helpful, accurate and quick.

The apartment is just as shown and described on the site which is positive. It’s a small place suitable for couples but don’t expect to get too much cooking done as the kitchen is tiny. Perfect place for sleeping, showering and off to sightseeing as it is well connected with the metro and is located in a safe and quiet area.
It's cute. It's eclectic. It's artsy, scholarly. The location is fantastic. Loved Yorkville! It's a bargain for this area.

name: Sagrada Familia up to 6
summary: Our spectacular apartment will make you fall in love with it: a living room that seems to be from wonderland, leading to a 3 bedroom, 2 bathrooms and a full equipped modern kitchen. An apartment of vanguard 1 minute away from the Sagrada Familia, 10
space: Words like comfort, location, sustainability and modernity are the perfect definition for this exclusive residences concept in Barcelona. The privileged location and views of this building makes possible to see the Sagrada Familia temple, and in a 10 minutes’ walk arrive to the city center, were the Modernist Barcelona merges with the business district combined with the most exclusive shops; Paseo de Gracia. 3 metro stops and the “Bus Turistic” for a perfect communication with any part of the city. Our building has 20 residences with 80 sqm with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms fully equipped with all the luxurious details and amenities for up to 8 people. It offers concierge service, daily cleaning of the apartments, electronic surveillance, safe, among others. Other services we offer are parking, purchase of food packages, discounts in upscale restaurants, baby cots, baby-sitters, and much more. You will enjoy the best connectivity with Wi-free, and you can enjoy our multimedia library; bo
description: Our spectacular apartment will make you fall in love with it: a living room that seems to be from wonderland, leading to a 3 bedroom, 2 bathrooms and a full equipped modern kitchen. An apartment of vanguard 1 minute away from the Sagrada Familia, 10 Words like comfort, location, sustainability and modernity are the perfect definition for this exclusive residences concept in Barcelona. The privileged location and views of this building makes possible to see the Sagrada Familia temple, and in a 10 minutes’ walk arrive to the city center, were the Modernist Barcelona merges with the business district combined with the most exclusive shops; Paseo de Gracia. 3 metro stops and the “Bus Turistic” for a perfect communication with any part of the city. Our building has 20 residences with 80 sqm with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms fully equipped with all the luxurious details and amenities for up to 8 people. It offers concierge service, daily cleaning of the apartments, electronic surveillance, saf
neighborhood_overview: Authentic district of Barcelona, the Eixample, with its chamfered cut corners, hiding in every meter modernist facades. Press to perfection with all the tourist spots of the city and all kind of services at hand.  Walking through its streets (Avenida Gaudí, Provence, Diagonal ...) know its essence.
