Nice location near volcano park and homelike atmosphere !! Due to kitchen , 2 restroom and  3 bedrooms, our two families really enjoyed easy and comfortable stay.. highly recommemd !!

The house is wonderful. It is clean and cozy. The three bedrooms and two bath are great for large group of people. The kitchen is also big and have all the things you want. By the way, it is a great place to see stars in the evening.
The hosts very responsive and left coffee for us!  The unit was huge and very quiet and convenient.

We really had a wonderful time in the house. We made meals together and made a celebration of Chinese New Year with my families! All kinds of cooking utensils are well-prepared in the kitchen and it is quite convenient! The environment outside is quite beautiful.

We reserved both levels of the house. The house was clean and well kept. The upper level is much nicer. Choose this level if you are not a large party. The hosts - Jimmy and Christine - were nice and did everything they could to accommodate. We had a problem with the hot water late in the evening and Jimmy drove 45 minutes to the house to fix it. We also had a smell problem in the lower floor, which they could not fix. They said they will partially reimburse us for this, which is nice of them.
Conveniently located.  Easy entry.  Very roomy.  It would have been nice if there had been some umbrellas or other rain gear as the weather wasn't that cooperative.
I have enjoy my stay, very thing as it described.
This was a very nice place to stay at

This house was perfect for our large group. Each family memner got thier own bed and that was awesome. we rented the entire house so we had upstairs and downstairs the space was a luxury. The neighborhood is a quiet area right next to the Volcano National Park which is exactly where we wanted to explore so this made everything very Easy for us. The house came with plenty of linens and everything we needed to keep warm and feel comfortable. I got The feeling like we were at an aunt's house or something, a little olden style, but quaint and cozy. The host was immediately there at the email that I sent when I lost the lock code. she also offered me an extension of stay (when I requested to stay a bit past check out tume)  because they had no one coming in immediately and I thought this was very kind of her! We will definitely be back. The description was accurate we are happy :)

We stayed here for our visit to the Volcano national park.  I fell in love with this comfortable and cozy home with its lush green surroundings.  The dehumidifiers were incredibly effective at keeping the apartment warm and dry.  Hilo was a quick 45 minute drive.  One of the best Airbnb experiences.  The host was very kind and communicative.
Very spacious, separation from downstairs unit is good, clean place, lots of useful kitchen things, comfy beds
Great location for getting to Volcano National Park.

We enjoyed staying at this home in the tropical forest near Volcanoes National Park. It is located in a quiet, secluded residential area and it gives you a real feel for how the locals live. There were a few neighborhood dogs barking when we arrived in the late afternoon, but by evening everything quieted down for good night's sleep. It is easy to find and only a couple miles from the park entrance. We had done this trip 15 years ago and it is so convenient to stay overnight at a home like this to enable another full day of exploring the Park.  This home is roomy and has a nice full size kitchen to cook meals for your family. There are plenty of towels and the bedrooms are roomy and comfortable. Plenty of blankets are available as well for those cool nights in the tropical forest!

This is a very quiet and beautiful place in the woods and literally minutes from the Volcano National Park and also the shops and restaurants in Volcano Village.  Easy to find and a superb place to stay while taking in the natural beauty of the national park.  It is indeed very chilly at night so the electric blankets on all beds was very nice.

We had a wonderful stay at Merlenna's place.  It was a great location!  We also appreciated the mattress heaters and extra blankets as it was a little cold the night we were there.  It was a very thoughtful touch.
房源的地點很靠近火山國家公園,但是我們很可惜的我們造訪時剛好遇到國家公園關閉,所以沒有辦法造訪｡Merlenna的房子為我們在雨中提供了很好的庇護,讓我們在一陣狼狽中可以得到很好的休息與安慰｡房源的佈置非常溫馨與溫暖,廚房一應俱全,房間非常舒適,浴室跟整潔都很好,是個很值得推薦的住處｡
Lush peaceful tranquil forest surroundings made the stay extra special

The Jade house (upstairs unit) is in good condition, very homey. While it may be a little dated in the interior looks, the space is functional and very cozy and comfortable. LOTS of blankets for chilly nights in Volcano and easy access to the park and nearby Volcano Village. Has basics in kitchen and bathrooms. Plenty of space to sleep six in bedrooms and a very comfortable living area with what looks like newer furniture than in the photos. Large TVs in master and living area, with books, DVDs, and games. Check closets for games and more blankets. A quiet and peaceful home, and if you stay in the upper unit you'll enjoy looking over ferns and through ohi'a trees. Beautiful location. Easy access as long as you're good with a few stairs and we loved the combo lock instead of having a key. Filtered water for drinking and hot water works great. We had four adults and we were allowed our two pugs which we brought with us from Kona and we are very grateful for that. Mahalo for sharing this home with us.

name: 2BR Prime West village~Sleeps 5
space: located in the heart of West village! . one of the most desirable neighborhood in NYC! steps away from some of the best shopping, dining and nightlife that NYC has to offer. Close access to the A, C, E, B, D, F, V, N, R, Q, 1, 2, 3,and 6 Train lines. The apartment is 2BR 1000 square feet, Large living room with sofa bed that can accommodate 2 person, fully equipped kitchen with a central seating area that can accommodate up to 4 guests. At night, Greenwich Village comes alive with sounds from restaurants, late-night coffeehouses, cafés, theaters, and music clubs. Anything and everything can be had from a great burger and fries from the Corner Bistro to an intimate candlelit dinner at One if by Land, Two if By Sea. Established restaurants in the neighborhood include Blue Ribbon, The Fatty Crab, Pastis, The Spotted Pig, Il Mulino, Tomoe The Village is also home to such famous jazz clubs as the Blue Note, Lions Den, and fabled coffeehouses including Caffe Reggio and Café Figaro. SHOPPING

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
Peace Love Laughs and Real Estat (Website hidden by Airbnb) 
Interior Design, Food and Travel

reviews.comments: Eran was a well meaning host and the apartment was in a great neighborhood. Unfortunately, we had the bad luck to have a few things go wrong (loss of Internet, broken front door knob, broken AC). Eran's responsiveness was sincere but less than effective. Given the price we paid, we expected a more professional management service.

Bad experience all together..
In a nutshell:
Leading up to arrival, Eran's communication was satisfactory at best.
One arrival, the place didn't look anywhere as good as it did in the pictures. Looked dull and run down.
Attention to detail with cleanliness and building standards were non existent. 
Shower had just been re done with the drain being blocked and shards of aluminum and mess still left over. 
Noise levels were excessive - it felt like we were literally sleeping on the street.
Bad experience all together. 
However, made better by the great resolution dispute team at Airbnb who refunded basically our entire stay (50nights) and were completely understanding. A very good reflection for the Airbnb brand.
The host canceled this reservation 32 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: Sunny & Private W'burg Townhouse
summary: This apartment occupies an entire floor of a newly renovated townhouse in prime Williamsburg. You'll have half of the floor entirely to yourself, with your own sunny, oversized bedroom, sitting area and private bathroom. Williamsburg, famous for its "hipster cool", is just one stop on the subway to Manhattan.
space: In this brand new renovation of a classic Brooklyn townhouse, you'll have a huge, entirely private master bedroom that includes a sitting area and your own private bathroom. The room features a queen-size bed, TV, large closet, and desk. You'll have access to the rest of the apartment, which includes a living room, dining area, and kitchen.
description: This apartment occupies an entire floor of a newly renovated townhouse in prime Williamsburg. You'll have half of the floor entirely to yourself, with your own sunny, oversized bedroom, sitting area and private bathroom. Williamsburg, famous for its "hipster cool", is just one stop on the subway to Manhattan. In this brand new renovation of a classic Brooklyn townhouse, you'll have a huge, entirely private master bedroom that includes a sitting area and your own private bathroom. The room features a queen-size bed, TV, large closet, and desk. You'll have access to the rest of the apartment, which includes a living room, dining area, and kitchen. In addition to your private area, the apartment also includes a large chef's kitchen with new appliances (perfect for cooking and making tea and coffee), a dining table, and a large sitting area with a high-end sound and entertainment system. There's a washer and dryer in the unit for you to do your laundry free of charge (a rarity in NYC). I'l
neighborhood_overview: Within a few blocks of the apartment, you'll discover the many reasons that Williamsburg has become the global definition of "cool".  At the famous Nitehawk Cinema, you can watch movies while being served brunch. At local coffee shops, like Devocion, Toby's Estate, and Blue Bottle, you can hang out with more hipsters than probably where else in the world. The nightlife is probably Williamsburg's strongest feature, with several excellent cocktail bars nearby (I especially like Hotel Delmano and Maison Premiere), many options for live music, as well as the two best nightclubs in NYC (Verboten and Output). In summer, there's the outdoor foodie market Smorgasburg. There's excellent shopping at unique boutiques: escape the chain stores and global luxury labels that now dominate Manhattan.
transit: The Bedford stop on the L train is a 10 minute walk away. From Bedford, it's 1 stop into Manhattan; you can be in Union Square in 5 minutes.  Most of the major tourist sites are easily accessible. From the Bedford L station, Times Square is about 15 minutes. However, I always recommend that visitors spend as little time as possible in the main tourist areas in midtown, and I'm happy to provide recommendations for the areas where locals hang out.  If you'd prefer not to take the subway, there is a constant supply of Uber cars in the neighborhood, as well as regular New York taxis.
access: In addition to your private area, the apartment also includes a large chef's kitchen with new appliances (perfect for cooking and making tea and coffee), a dining table, and a large sitting area with a high-end sound and entertainment system. There's a washer and dryer in the unit for you to do your laundry free of charge (a rarity in NYC).
interaction: I'll be staying in the apartment's second bedroom, which is on the other end of the floor. I have my own private bathroom.  I love meeting new people and giving my guests recommendations for things to do and see in the neighborhood.
house_rules: Max. 2 people; no babies, please. No smoking permitted. Please respect the neighbors by not making noise very late at night.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I'm an entrepreneur and attorney based in New York. I spend a lot of time abroad -- normally several months every year -- and love to share my neighborhood with other travelers from around the world. Please send me a message if you have any questions!

reviews.comments: Andrew is a great guy. His appartment is amazing! Very neat and closeby of all the hotspots in Williamsburg. He gave us good tips where to go. I would definately recommend staying here, u will not regret it!
Andrew was kind, attentive and his space clean, comfortable and well curated.

This apartment is excellent. It's full of light and is very spacious with lovely new furniture and nice new fittings. It seems to have been renovated recently. The room is very large, with an ensuite bathroom.  These areas can be separated off from the rest of the apartment and are private. 

Andrew was a really excellent host as well; he made me very welcome.  He has a stack of information about New York and Williamsburg.

The area is great as well - right in Williamsburg, close to Bedford Ave, with lots of cafes and places to eat nearby. It's about an 8 minute walk to the subway (the L) at Bedford Ave.  You can see the  East River and Manhattan from the living  room, looking down the street.

Andrew has a fantastic apartment with ample living space and was an excellent host, offering me a welcome gin & tonic and a tour of the neighborhood upon arrival.  Given the privacy created by the second bedroom, the overall setup of the apartment (spacious kitchen and full dining table, good light and renovated amenities), prime location, hospitality of the host and price point, I think this is one of the better values on AirBnB.  Highly recommended!

The service I received from Andrew was very professional. The apartment was beautifully appointed and the surrounding area interesting. It was also conveniently located to catch the the subway and easy to get to manhattan.

Andrew's apartment truly was a rare find! As a fellow Airbnb host in the city, I set a high standard and expectation when I comes to the listings i would recommend to friends. Since my family was in town and I was unable to house my friends who were visiting, I had found Andrew's apartment in Williamsburg. The location is fantastic. Walking distance to the Bedford L train which is only one stop from Manhattan, and is conveniently located in the heart of Williamsburg, where plenty of great coffee shops and restaurants can be found among a very lively nightlife. The apartment itself is meticulously clean and beautifully furnished. The private room is enormous for nyc standards, on top of which has taken own bathroom. Andrew was very hospitable and I wouldn't be hesitant in recommending this place to my friends and family.

I had a fantastic experience staying with Andrew in Williamsburg. His apartment was perfectly located in close proximity to the subway and good bars/restaurants. Andrew provided everything I could possibly need, including a clean bedroom/private bathroom, towels, sheets, etc. He also made the check in and check out process extremely easy, allowing me to stick to my own schedule on my way out. Helped out greatly during an initial scheduling pickle as well. I would highly recommend staying here when in NYC.

Our stay at Andrew's place was just perfect. He made us welcome from the first minute, gave great recommendations about the neighborhood and was always accessible for any requests we had. The house is just as advertised, sunny, spacious and very comfortable. It's also only minutes away from bustling Williamsburg with a ton of cafes, restaurants and boutiques at your disposal and just one subway stop away from Manhattan. All in all, a great stay and a definite recommendation for anybody looking for a place in New York.

Andrew is a fantastic host and his apartment is spotless and beautifully appointed, with plenty of space and privacy for guests. He was always available to attend to any queries I had about the place and the neighbourhood. The apartment is also in a great location; still very close to Manhattan and easily accessible. I highly recommend staying here!

Hemos tenido una estancia maravillosa en la preciosa casa de Andrew. Èl es un anfitrión estupendo e hizo que nos sintiéramos como en casa. El barrio de Williamsburg en Brooklin está muy cerca de Manhattan y es muy animado y bonito. 100% recomendable, volveremos seguro! 

We had a wonderful experience in the beautiful house of Andrew. He is a perfect host and he made us feel very comfortable like at home. The neighbourhood of Williamsburg in Brooklin is very closed to Manhattan and is very nice. 100% recommended, we come back for sure.

If you're looking for a lovely place to stay in a great location with a very friendly and helpful host then you can't go wrong with Andrew's flat in Williamsburg - a really exciting neighbourhood in Brooklyn very close to midtown Manhattan by subway but so much more to explore there than we managed in our day there.  We have nothing to complain about from our stay, everything was perfect.

Our stay at Andrew's place coudn't have been better. The place is exactly as described. It is a completly renovated building, really well located in the heart of the trendy and vibrant Williamsburg. Everything is new and super clean in this charming appartment and there is a private bathroom with bath in the room! 
 It is also very quiet, we were surprised to wake up with the sound of birds in the morning!
Andrew was really helpful giving us some good adresses and tips during our stay.  
It is a enjoyable 10 min or less walk to Bedford subway station, and just one station to Manhattan. Also, we had no problem to find a spot to park our car for free in the area. 
I wouldn't hesitate any second to come back at Andrew's place for another Newyorker/Brooklyner week end, and would highly recommend it to any of my friends!

This is a great spot; my daughter and I stayed there recently and everything was clean and convenient. It is a location perfect for walking Brooklyn and the Williamsburg Bridge. Andrew is helpful and willing to give advice on where to go and what to see. Great choice!

Andrew was an awesome host and very accommodating during my 5 night stay. The apartment is just as described and is in a great area, close to cool restaurants and coffee shops to hangout in. I'd definitely return!

Andrew was a fantastic host. He provided us with recommendations on places to eat nearby and was happy to assist with any queries we had. The description of his place is totally accurate. As other reviews have mentioned, the room is modern and spotless, with all the amenities you would need and very private with its own bathroom. It was better than some hotels we have stayed at! The location is perfect for exploring Williamsburg. Close to the action as it is near to Wythe and Bedford Aves and felt very safe. There is a good coffee shop just a couple of doors down, and a nice Italian restaurant across the road. The subway is about 10 mins away and only a couple of stops on the L train to the heart of Manhattan. We had a great time here and would wholeheartedly recommend Andrew's apartment to anyone wanting to stay in Williamsburg. Superb value. Thanks Andrew!

Andrew is a perfect host and frienly flatmate. He is a nice and easy-going person always willing to facilitate your stay and give good recommendations. The flat is very cool, cozy and nicely decorated. It is located in the heart of Williamsburg, very close to main spots in this trendy neighborhood. The room is equipped with all kind of conveniences and details that make your stay more comfortable. I strongly recommend Andrew's place, our experience exceeded our expectations. Thanks Andrew!!

Het bezoek en de correspondentie met Andrew verliep zeer vlot en soepel. Door middel van het vertrouwen voelden we ons meteen welkom. Andrew is zeer behulpzaam en vriendelijk en denkt mee. Hij heeft alles super op orde. Kortom, een AWESOME verblijf. 

Zijn verblijf ligt centraal in Williamsburg.

Williamsburg, Brooklyn is een artistieke buurt. De wijk is super hip. Hier vinden veel activiteiten plaats en je kan er goed eten (Andrew geeft je ook goede tips). Cafes en restaurantjes op max. 10 min lopen. 

Lekkere koffie bij Devocion om de hoek, Bagels bij Bagelsmith (om de hoek bij de metro), Koreaans eten bij Dekobi, etc.

Het is zeer goed te doen met de metro (lijn L en op 10 min. lopen) en wij vonden al snel onze weg. 

Vriendelijke mensen en behulpzaam als je ze aanspreekt.

We had a very pleasant stay at Andrew's apartment. The apartment is spacious, well equipped and Andrew didn't mind us using his kitchen and other facilities. He is an excellent host with a lot of local knowledge. During the booking phase and our stay he was available for any advice and requests. Most of the time he replied within a few minutes!

Andrews apartment is well situated if you want tot stay in 'Hipster' Williamsburg. The Metro is approximately 10 minutes walk and there are plenty of nice restaurants and bars close by. Compared to Manhattan in Williamsburg there is a much more laid back vibe. 

We can recommend this apartment to anyone who wants to stay in Williamsburg.

Andrew thanks for your hospitality
Andrew's place is in a perfect Williamsburg location. Everything was spotless and comfortable and Andrew is a great host!

Andrew deserves to be featured by airbnb as a perfect airbnb host! I had a great experience at his place: immaculately clean, sunny and perfectly equipped...and Andrew was very welcoming and helpful. I will definitely come back during my next trip to NY! Thank you Andrew

It was the first booking airbnb and it was definitely the best accommodation we could get. We really enjoyed our stay in this wonderful apartment, clean, sunny and perfectly equipped! It's located in a really trendy neighborhood in Williamburg with lots of great restaurants, bars and shops nearby. Andrew is an excellent host, very kind, caring and charming. It was a wonderful experience and we´re looking forward to coming back!

Andrew was a fantastic host for my recent stay in New York. He was very responsive and provided us with tips to make the most out of our stay. The apartment is beautifully furnished and well located. I would definitely stay here again!

My 12-year-old son and I had a wonderful experience staying at Andrew's beautiful Williamsburg condo, perfectly located in Williamsburg, a block away from the river and Manhattan views. Andrew provided great recommendations for eating and transportation throughout our five-day, four-night stay. He was a friendly, intelligent and gracious host throughout.
Andrew was a great host, he did every thing he said he would for us. Location is spot on for a Williamsburg experience. Highly recommended.

This is a wonderful place for any of those who are seeking the following features

1. Good location.
 I wasn't really informed of the Williamsburg and its surroundings. Yet, I had to change my plans just to spend a day near the beautiful neighborhood. Andrew's house is close to many of the good cafes, restaurants, and the brooklyn market if you are planning to cook home. 

2. Neat and comfortable room and amenities. 
The room is large and comfortable to sleep, stay, and store your luggage. Never felt uncomfortable with the room.
Internet router is inside the room, and so I had the fastest wifi access than in any other places during my stay in NYC.  
You also have laundry machines, AC, and a chrome cast if you want to play music or watch a movie. 

3. Fair accessibility to Manhattan
It is around 10 min walk to the L station which goes to the core of Manhattan. Major tourist attractions and museums in Manhattan are within 30-35 minute accessibility including walking time.

Can't say enough good things about this apartment. It's an awesome neighborhood full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops and so much more. Andrew was the best host. So helpful and friendly. I loved this place and I highly recommend it.

The location of Andrews apartment was fantastic, very close to all of the main tourist spots (if you take the subway) but brilliant for if you want to experience New York like a local. 

Andrews apartment is so cool and has everything you could need inside. The bed was super comfy, bathroom a great size and accessible from your room. He also lets you use the kitchen which I thought was a nice touch. 

Andrew is the perfect host. He knows everything there is to know about where to go to enjoy New York and how to get there. 

I will have no hesitation recommending Andrews place to all my friends and those planning a trip to NYC.

The apartment was just like the pictures! The private room is spacious and it is nice that you have your own bathroom. Andrew was a good host, nice and friendly and everything was well arranged. We loved the location, and the neighborhood of Williamsburg. We had dinner in Williamsburg the whole week and never went to Manhattan for that, because there are so many nice places to go. Our favorites where: Walter Foods, Sweetwater and Oregano (Italian). From the Bedford subway it is only 3 stops to Union square station wherefrom you can go everywhere quickly. It was our first Airbnb experience and this was really a very good start!

Andrew was a very present host, he made sure we had everything we needed and was available for suggestions for sight seeing and food options.  He was very accomodating and took our reservation last minute.  Would highly recommend, loved Williamsburg neighbourhood and the room and bathroom were fantastic.

Had a wonderful stay at Andy's apartment due in no small part to its appointment and his hosting skills. Our paths crossed three or four times over our stay and he always had a pleasant word or a recommendation about what to see or do
The apartment was in fact better than the description on line - really airy and bright and our room (with its en-suite) was great. As we were on a road trip it was good to have plenty of wardrobe space to hang clothes. Also as an aside his broadband speed was lightening quick - 45 mb/s. 
The neighbourhood of Williamsburgh is up and  coming and trendy with every one wired to either their phone, tablet or laptop. Ate out three nights locally and never felt apprehensive or concerned about walking home afterwards - really pleasant. 
We loved staying with Andy for all the above reasons but also, for us personally were the views of Manhatten from the park at the bottom of his road (100 metres).  The classic sky line just laid there in front of you - way better than staying IN Manhatten. The same applied to using the East river ferry ($4) to upper or lower Manhatten, a 10 minute walk and way better views than being sat on the subway.

I loved this place! I can't wait to come back! Andrew was a fantastic host. The place is super clean and the decor is fantastic. It's very quiet and just a short stroll to my favorite things: SweetGreens, Starbucks, Soul Cycle, local shopping, hip coffee shops and great local stores and restaurants.

L'appartement d'Andrew est aussi agréable que lui, 
un logement lumineux, très bien localisé, dans un quartier fort agréable. 
Notre chambre était spacieuse, lumineuse, tranquille donnant sur un jardin; La salle de bain pratique, propre,
Andrew est un hôte à la fois discret et accueillant, 
je le recommande!

Nous rêvons de revenir faire un séjour à Williamsburg le plus tôt possible

Antonio

AWSOME
Andrew:)
Williamsburg:)
Spatial:)
Organised:)
Max:)
Extraordinary:)

Very comfortable apartment, the landlord is just helpful and so nice. 

We really had a great time during our stay, the neighbors are full of fancy restaurants, shops, and everything you need. 

The kitchen is nice too, we make some cooks which is awesome

Anyway, thumbs up to Andrew and his house!

To be in Andrew´s place was fantastic!!!, he was very, but very helpfull   and generous, I had there anything I needed, his apartament is beautifull and so comfortable and nice decorated and he made me feel at home. 
The neighborhood couldn´t be nicer and safe and is so close from Bedford Street which is surrounded by an amazing amount of interesting shops and cofees and restaurants, and at a very short walking distance you can get  lane L and in one stop you are in Manhattan!!!
I strongly recomend Andrew as a host!!!! I loved to be there!!!!

I have mixed feelings on leaving this review, as I intend to stay here in the near future and if I gush too much, there may be no availability.  

I have to say that Andrew was the perfect host (even from Australia) and it was the perfect apartment.  It was sunny and warm during some very cold days and just pleasant to be in a place that was so well furnished and laid out.  The pantry was stocked, there was pour-over coffee and the bed was quite comfortable.  I can't wait to come back!

We really enjoyed staying at Andrews apartment. It was very clean, modern and in a great neighbourhood. We really liked Williamsburg and would recommend staying here when visiting New York! Andrew was really helpful and friendly and kindly let us help ourselves to breakfast! The flat had everything we needed and was nice and spacious.

Andrew ensured I was fully aware of how to enter his apartment and the building. Excellent communication by Andrew post booking, pre arrival and on arrival, in fact he made me feel totally at home. The location is great and close to all the restuarants, bars and public travel facilities. Every picture tells a story! So Andrew's posted photographs are accurate plus some. A great bedroom with ensuite and very very comfortable living room with all the mod cons in the kitchen. Overall a extremely comfortable and worthy experience. Similarly, Andrew is a likeable man who takes pride in his apartment. Five stars and highly recommended.
My second stay at Andrew's apartment in Williamsburg in the last month. Refer to previous positive comments. Nothing changed: still a great place to stay.

Las indicaciones y consejos que dejó sobre el uso del apartamento y  sobre los alrededores nos sirvieron mucho para estar "como en casa". El barrio es espectacular, al igual que el apartamento. Nos dejó una guía con algunos sitios para visitar y mereció la pena. Todo un acierto!!!
Lo recomendamos sin lugar a dudas!!!

Andrew's place is perfect for a short stay in Williamsburg; conveniently located to restaurants, shops, and the subway, it's is a great spot to be if you're looking to be centrally located. 
The apartment is bright, spacious and modern. The room is equipped with a private bathroom and views of a lush courtyard. Set up on the third floor, a good nights sleep is ensured. 
Andrew is around to answer any questions and ensure a comfortable stay. I have only positive reports from my stay at Andrew's apartment, and would certainly recommend to anyone in consideration.

Andrew (as a host) and the apartment are both brilliant. Seriously, just book this place if it is available! 

The room is spacious, clean and has a great ensuite shower room. Kick back in the living room with the fast wifi connection and tv or head to any one of the great Williamsburg cafes just walking distance from Andrew's flat.

The perfect flat for a perfect stay in Williamsburg. I hope to be back!

This place is amazing: Spacious, light, clean and very quiet but still in a great location close to bars, shops, restaurant and the subway. Andrew was a great host, I would definitely book this again :-)

Andrew es un excelente anfitrión, respetuoso de la intimidad de uno y a su vez, bien dispuesto para ayudar ante cualquier necesidad que uno tenga.
Fue nuestra primera experiencia compartiendo hospedaje y la verdad que no pudo haber sido mejor.
El departamento es tal cual se ve en las fotos. Gran tamaño y mucha luz. Muy confortable.
La zona es muy linda si uno busca estar bien cerca de Manhattan y a su vez tener la posibilidad de disfrutar un poco más de tranquilidad. En la esquina está el East River donde se pueden disfrutar los atardeceres y está lleno de lugares para comer, tomar algo,etc.
La distancia al subte es de 7 cuadras aproximadamente. Primer parada de Brooklyn del metro L.
Fue muy flexible con horario de ingreso y salida. Nos dejo dejar todas nuestras valijas en el departamento hasta el momento de irnos al aeropuerto.
Muchísimas gracias otra vez Andrew por todo!
Ciertamente si volvemos sería un alojamiento a repetir!

We had a wonderful stay at Andrew's beautiful home. It really made our trip to Manhattan and Brooklyn even better. Will definitely come back next year! Prime location only 50m away from the Hudson river with great views overlooking Manhattan and 20m away from all the great shops in Williamsburg.

Thank you Andrew:)

Andrew has been such a great host! He was willing to help in anything we needed. It was the first time we shared a place and it has been a super great experience as in NY your're almost never ar home during the day so it was easier! Also... the neighbourhood is super cool with plenty of stores and restaurants and bars. Lots of people specially during weekends. It is also 5 min walf from the metro and from there only a couple of stops to Manhattan. Last, but not least, Andrew is super tidy and he was even worried about a lamp that has been broken by the previous guest and managed to replace it during our stay. The apartment is as it looks in the pictures... super comfy and cool. Thanks Andrew for hosting us in your apartment! Saludos, Gus and Paz.-

The appartement is placed in a hip upcoming area with great views of Manhattan. Lots of cafes and restaurants around. Takes 15min scenic ferry trip to Manhattan. Nicely decorated, quiet apparement. Friendly host.
Great location within 5 mins of subway and ferry. Great coffee shops bars and restaurants. Apartment has all the conveniences you’d need and is very stylishly furnished.

This is the best Williamsburg stay for me. I definitely recommend to stay here instead of tiny, dirty, noisy hotel rooms. 

Andrew is the great host. He is accurate, kind and helpful. 
I have a problem with my lower back but the bed in the room is good enough to support my back. 

I recommend someone who loves cozy Williamsburg life.
Andrew was a wonderful host and his space is perfect. Clean, stylish, best location, and private and comfortable. I’d choose to be here again every time!

Andrew’s apartment is incredibly clean, stylish, and comfortable! It exceeded my expectations! Andrew had everything we needed, including super comfy pillows and cereal for breakfast! He also recommended lots of cool coffee shops, restaurants, and events in the neighborhood. It’s the little things, y’all. The only thing that would make it better would be if it were a little closer to the subway. But I’d stay again!

Clean, stylish, and quiet space in a lively neighborhood. Communication with Andrew was easy and everything was very organized. Perfect for someone who wants to experience Williamsburg or Manhattan with some peace and quiet.
You can expect a clean, stylish, comfortable experience when you stay here. Andrew is very responsive and his apartment exceeds expectations. It was a peaceful place in the middle of a busy city.

We highly recommend this centrally located apartment in the hip Williamsburg section of Brooklyn. Loads of great shops and dining within blocks and a Whole Foods nearby. A nice diversion from the usual Manhattan hotels that are at least twice the price. Andrew’s apartment was clean, stylish, and amazingly quiet at night in a busy city.  There’s a washing machine and dryer, being able to wash clothes was brilliant. We were able to come home with clean clothes. The apartment was stocked with the essentials like, laundry soap, shampoo, body wash, teas, condiments in the fridge. If you were a staying in a hotel, you would only have a mini fridge. We would book this again on our next visit to NYC.

Andrew's place is one of my favorite Airbnb rentals I've ever stayed at. The apartment is clean, stylish, and above all, comfortable. The room and bathroom had everything I needed, and the space is full of thoughtful touches that make you feel perfectly at home, like a Sonos speaker in the bedroom that you can use and extra fluffy pillows. The bed is also the most comfortable bed away from home I've ever slept in. 

Even though technically this rental was for a private room in a shared space, I felt like I had the place to myself and only ran into Andrew once during my four-night stay. Not that I would have minded if we'd seen each other more — he's polite and welcoming, and I felt at ease in his home. The location is excellent; it's about a 10-minute walk to the L-train to get into Manhattan, and the surrounding neighborhood is lined with cool restaurants, bars, and shops. This place is a great value, and I'm glad I stayed there instead of a hotel. Thanks for the hospitality, Andrew!

name: Tutu's Hale with a View (Grandma's House)
summary: Gorgeous renovated 4 bedroom 2 bath house situated in a peaceful cul de sac neighborhood up in Keolu Hills overlooking beautiful Kailua Bay.  A quick 5 minute drive takes you to downtown Kailua and the world famous Kailua and Lanikai Beaches.
space: 3 generations of native Hawaiians call this place home.  Thanks to our Tutu (Grandma), there's tons of Aloha (love) shared here with our friends and `Ohana (family) of which we wish to share with you.  Feel free to enjoy a cool, and tranquil environment with a spacious open air living room, kitchen and dining area.
description: Gorgeous renovated 4 bedroom 2 bath house situated in a peaceful cul de sac neighborhood up in Keolu Hills overlooking beautiful Kailua Bay.  A quick 5 minute drive takes you to downtown Kailua and the world famous Kailua and Lanikai Beaches. 3 generations of native Hawaiians call this place home.  Thanks to our Tutu (Grandma), there's tons of Aloha (love) shared here with our friends and `Ohana (family) of which we wish to share with you.  Feel free to enjoy a cool, and tranquil environment with a spacious open air living room, kitchen and dining area. When you're not outside enjoying the lush green mountains or sun drenched beaches of the windward side, feel free to relax reading a book on local history; stream a movie flick; or make yourself a good meal & cocktail while you take in the view from our home. We want to respect your privacy and will keep contact to a minimum.  Nonetheless, after check-in if you need assistance, our property manager (Vai) will be a phone call away. Take
neighborhood_overview: Take a quick 5 minute ride to Kailua town for immediate access to hip boutique shops and great local cuisine.  Enjoy a great cup of coffee at Morning Brew Cafe; a healthy smoothie or fruit bowl at Lankai Juice Company; or grab a great sandwich on your way to the beach at Kalapawai Market.  Shaved Ice at Island Snow when it gets too hot.  Ready for a cocktail?  Head over to Buzz's for a tropical drink by the beach or get back to Kailua town for one at Cactus.  Right down the street at the Enchanted Lake Shopping Center, you can stock up on groceries for the house or snacks for your daily activities. Looking Makai (towards ocean), you'll have access to world class powder white sand beaches with a host of ocean activities whether it's swimming, diving, kayaking, or stand-up paddle boarding.  Turn Mauka (towards the mountains), there are many scenic hikes to gorgeous waterfalls or spectacular views all without leaving the Windward Side of the island.
notes: Our hale (house) is fully furnished with 3 queen size beds and 1 full size bed. We love to cook and so our kitchen has all major appliances and basic cooking essentials that you're welcome to use.  W(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)
transit: A rental car is recommended but you could easily get around renting a bicycle via Pedego or even walking to most areas.  There's also "TheBus" which has two routes that run routinely near our home the 57 and 57a to get you to and from Kailua and the Honolulu Area.  Transfer from downtown Honolulu or Ala Moana Shopping Center to other destinations like Waikiki or Diamond Head.  For more information check out ((URL HIDDEN)
access: When you're not outside enjoying the lush green mountains or sun drenched beaches of the windward side, feel free to relax reading a book on local history; stream a movie flick; or make yourself a good meal & cocktail while you take in the view from our home.
interaction: We want to respect your privacy and will keep contact to a minimum.  Nonetheless, after check-in if you need assistance, our property manager (Vai) will be a phone call away.
house_rules: This is our grandparents home and a home that will be passed to our future generations.  We ask that you Aloha a Mālama (love, respect and care for) our home as if it was your grandparent's home. Parking:  You can park up to 3 cars in the driveway. If you need more space, please park your cars along the front of the picket fence. It's ok to park up close to the fence on the grass if needed to allow the neighbors' cars to pass. PLEASE NOTE:  Please do NOT park anywhere on the property across the street.  The easement is their only parking and so we do wish to encroach. Shoes, Dirty Feet and Island Style: When you're visiting the island, island culture is to take off your shoes, flip flops, and sandals and leave them at the door before entering. Make sure to wash off the beach sand, dirt or mud outside before coming into the house.   PLEASE NOTE:  If on check-out and inspection, our property manager finds an excessive amount of sand or dirt in the house, an extra fee of $50 may be impose

host.host_about:
Born and raised on O'ahu Hawai'i and spend much time between home and San Francisco, California.

Ho'okipa (hospitality) has been a part of my family and culture since the beginning.  I pride myself on sharing my ike (knowledge) of my islands whether it's our culture, history, the land or the ocean.

reviews.comments: I am so happy I booked my stay here for my boyfriend and I while we were in town for a wedding. The house was so beautiful and fully renovated. I really enjoyed the high ceilings and stunning kitchen - made cooking at home feel like a vacation too. The home got a great breeze (so long as you open all the windows) and the rooms were comfortable and relaxing. The house had many authentic emblems of Hawaiian culture and waterman sports as well as the owner's family decorated through out it. The town in Kailua was bustling and we were only 10 minutes away from Lanakai Beach. I did window shopping and picked up some nice snorkeling gear in town too. The grocery store (Foodlands) offers yummy poke (which I had for lunch nearly everyday) and I was in love with the local fruit flavored mochi balls (with ice cream filling). The property manager - Vai was welcoming and I only really reached out to her when I first got there but she gave us some great advice on where to eat, which beaches to get rentals from, and where to find items in the house. Between my boyfriend and myself we used our netflix, apple, and amazon IDs to watch movies and tv in the evenings (bc there is no cable) which was a perfect way to end nights when we wanted to stay in. I can't wait to bring my family here next time since the house is huge. I'd recommend this place to any friends visiting Oahu.

Our stay at Tutu's Hale home couldn't have been better. Blaine and his host / caretaker were easy to work with and very accommodating. The home was perfect and "exactly" like the photos. Great location in Kailua for ease of travel to the east side of Oahu and the rest of the island. My family and I are not the typical tourists....we don't like Wikki and Blaine's home was a perfect base of operations for our daily water activities. Highly recommend it and will stay there again.

The house is beautifull! With excellent views over the mountain and in the far distance the sea. Very clean, fully equiped kitchen And good beds. I really can recommend this house to anyone! We really enjoyed our time And we felt at home.

Despite our late evening arrival, Vai graciously greeted us at the door, making sure the air was flowing and that we were well situated. In the kitchen, there was a nice welcome basket filled with goodies to hold us down until the following morning.  The house looked newly renovated; was very clean, comfortable & spacious; and had all the comforts of home (farmhouse kitchen sink, appliances, nice kitchen & bath tiles, sheets, bath towels, beach towels, etc). 
    Lanikai Beach is a short drive from the house, so we were able to enjoy a morning swim and snorkeling.  A market, Starbucks, and a few fast food restaurants are conveniently nearby as well. Great place to stay if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Tutu's Hale is a beautiful home located in a Kailua.  It is close to the local shops and some of the most amazing beaches of Oahu.   Our family of six enjoyed our stay at this delightful and welcoming home.  The open layout and well-equipped kitchen were very much appreciated.  The morning sunrises are spectacular.  Blaine and Vai are gracious hosts.  We would recommend Tutu's Hales to our family and friends.

The house is super clean and perfectly located for a family who prefers a quiet residential area to a tourist spot while still very close to the top notch beaches - just 5 minutes' drive.  Haven't had a chance to meet Blaine or his agent who manages the property, but they contacted me way before our arrival with kind notes and sufficient instructions.  It could have been better if there were AC's, but the breeze itself sufficiently cools off the air in the evenings.  There were ants, but that was bearable.  Highly recommendable for a family who wants to stay away from a tourist spot but still wants to be close enough to Kailua & Lanikai.

We were contacted and warmly greeted by Vai (property manager) prior to arrival. The home was a perfect home away from home. No air conditioning (which is standard for the island), but fans in every room do the trick nicely. The home is just as described and then some. Having access to snorkels and towels left us one less thing to worry about! All appliances in the home were top notch & the cutlery & plates were beautiful! My family completely enjoyed our stay and felt like we were part of the "ohana"!!!
Thank you for a wonderful stay! We would love to come back again and make more wonderful memories in your lovely home.

Blaine and his property manager Vai was very prompt and welcoming. The home was beautiful and had everything we needed from the kitchen supplies to the snorkeling gear for the kids. The welcome basket gave us a taste of the islands right away. The house was immaculate and looks like the pictures. Only issue for us was there was no AC but there were fans in every room and that helped when the island wind came. The location was great close to restaurants and 2 miles from Kailua beach. 
Upon departing Blaine had notified us that we left a small hole in the wall possibly from moving some furniture. He was very kind about it and waived the fee for fixing it. 
Overall our family had an amazing time in Oahu, a big part thanks to your beautiful home. Will be recommending this place to friends and family!

This home was perfect for our group of 4 couples visiting the islands for a wedding. We loved the location, neighborhood and especially how close it was to Lanikai Beach! Our hosts were very welcoming and available if we had any questions. The house was very well kept, updated and has pretty much everything we needed for a wonderful stay. We appreciated the extra beach toys, Hawaiian snacks as a welcome, 3 parking spots and lots of room for our group to hang out in the house. It was only 25-30 minutes from Waikiki and about an 45-1hour to North Shore. I would definitely recommend to other groups!

Nestled on a quiet cul-de-sac in the laid-back Hawaiian town of Kailua, Tutu’s Hale delivers as a peaceful respite on the oft-overlooked windward (or east) side of Oahu.  Short story: My wife and I traveled to Oahu 10 years ago.  We stayed in a hotel on Waikiki Beach, we largely kept to Honolulu (beaches, shopping, restaurants, etc.), we spent a lot of money, and had a miserable time.  We were determined this time to really experience all that Oahu had to offer, and generally avoid the heavy tourist areas.  Instead of the traffic and headaches of Honolulu, we opted to stay in Kailua – which turned out to be a great decision.  If you are concerned that Kailua may be too far from the action of Honolulu, don’t worry.  With the Pali Highway (Route 61), Route 72, and H3, we found ourselves only a scenic 30-minute drive from downtown Honolulu, Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay, Pearl Harbor, or the junction to North Shore.  If you don’t believe me, check out these images – this is your drive every day! (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

The house we stayed in was a spacious 3-bedroom, 2-bath with a massive kitchen (the owner said there’s even a 4th bedroom if you need it, for just a little more). “Fully furnished” does not quite describe the attention to detail and valuable extras that are provided.  Snorkeling gear (check!), boogie boards (check!), ice coolers (check!), washer/dryer (check!), as well as tons of kitchenware, a massive gas grill under the carport, and more. We saved a lot of money on gear we didn’t need to rent, and saved time not having to make that extra trip to the store for “essentials.”  A flat-screen TV, Apple TV, and a nice wi-fi setup bring this vintage Hawaiian home into the digital age.  There are some great restaurants (4-star or better on Yelp, Saigon Noodle House was one of our favorites - (Website hidden by Airbnb) just a mile away in a nearby shopping center, or in downtown Kailua.  Kailua Beach and Lanakai Beach are just a short drive away, and quickly became our favorite beaches of the trip.  We got way more for our money in Kailua, and truly felt like we had been to Oahu for the first time.

Bottom line: If you want to sip umbrella drinks on Wakiki Beach, with a short walk back to an overpriced, tiny condo, this is not the place for you.  But if you want to feel like you are truly living in Hawaii, and experience the island from the perspective of a multi-generational Hawaiian family (the photos are right on the walls!) – with all the modern perks you would expect, I highly recommend this property.

This is my family's first time in Hawaii and we had a wonderful time here! Blaine's place provided a perfect place for us to stay and live a local's life. The neighborhood is very quite and clean. Safeway and gas station are just a five minutes drive away and the nearby beaches are amazing! Vai the property manager is very responsive and replied all my questions promptly. Will definitely stay here again next time we are in Hawaii!

My family and I recently stayed at Blaine's beautiful home in Kailua. I had a mix up in our plans and Blaine was extremely accommodating to help us modify our reservation dates.

Both Blaine and his property manager, Vai were very responsive and accessible. They welcomed us with a gift basket full of Hawaiian goodies. 

The home was very comfortable for our family of six. The kitchen is beautifully remodeled, as are the bathrooms. You could tell the remodel was done with meticulous care. 

The location is just a short drive from Lanikai, my girlfriend and my favorite beach on Oahu. Also nearby is Kailua beach park where you can easily rent all sorts of toys for beach activities including surf boards, stand up paddle boards, kayaks, snorkeling gear, etc. Blaine kindly offered us to use his boogie boards, snorkeling gear and beach mats, which came quite handy. 

I do have to say, however, that the house can get quite hot. I thought there would be air conditioning but as I had learned, it's not common to have air condition in the homes in that area. It was also unusually hot for the time of year that we stayed. Opening the windows does help a bit. Despite that, I would still definitely stay at Blaine's place again. His and Vai's hospitality helped top off our vacation! 

If you're looking to get away from the busy and crowded Waikiki area, I would highly suggest staying at Tutu's Hale!

What a beautiful home! Felt VERY homey and our family loved our stay here. You can see it is a very lived in home, with many pictures of grandparents, 3 generations of family photos, traditional hawaiian decor, everything is well taken care of! With beautiful furniture, modern appliances, and a renovated HGTV kitchen. Close to many amenities and grocery stores. Only 30 minutes from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki (which we wanted to avoid 90% of the time anyways) and only 7 minutes away from kailua beach and lanikai beach! MAHALO for hosting us, we will definitely start looking for a return trip with our Ohana! :)

Tutu's house was great!  Blaine and his property manager, Vai, were fast with communication by email before the trip and by text when we needed anything during the trip.  The house is well kept, and the space is great!  We stayed here with 6 adults, 1 toddler and 1 baby and fit comfortably.  There is a company nearby that we rented a playpen from for my nephew to sleep in and they delivered it free because it was so close!...and Vai helped coordinate that to have it delivered and set up before we even arrived.

The location is great.  We were only 5-10 min from one of the nicest beaches, Lanikai beach!  Take note that it's just a few minutes past Kailua beach which we originally mistook it for.  Both are beautiful!  We were also a 7 min drive from tons of great restaurants (just check on Yelp) and Foodland, where we had delicious tuna poke on the DAILY.

I would definitely recommend Tutu's to friends and would even stay here again.  Location was great, hosts were great, the house was great!

My only concern were the micro ants in the kitchen...but as long as you keep the place clean and don't leave your food laying out, you'll be fine!

What a beautiful home! Everything was clean and in perfect order on our arrival. The neighborhood is quiet. A tremendous amount of love and care has gone into the renovation of Tutu's Hale. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Blaine was quite welcoming; Vai (property manager) was helpful, checking in with us before and during our stay to ensure our satisfaction. Upon arrival, we discovered a very clean home with island treats. The home offers a personal touch with pictures of family members. The view was great; the neighborhood was very nice. The home is located close to shopping and restaurants. The kitchen is fabulous and well stocked with all you need to make your own dinners. Bedrooms were comfortable. Beach toys were provided along with an umbrella and cooler.

Great home!   Everything was clean and well maintained.  The kitchen is amazingly well equipped and ready to make full dinners for whole family and friends.  The view from dining room, looking down the town of Kailua is beautiful and the backyard is so relaxing and perfect for morning coffee. I would definitely recommend to other groups!

I really love to stay in the house. I felt it was my own house, it was so comfortable. Blaine and his team was easy to contact, very kind and helpful. Blaine and his house made my first trip to Oahu perfect.

Blaine's family home was a perfect getaway for me and my family. Not only was there ample room for the three of us, but we found the location and amenities at the house more than capable of fulfilling everything we wanted to do on our first trip to Oahu. Vai, the property manager, was attentive and helpful if ever a question arose. If you're looking for a Hawaiian getaway, but want to avoid the hustle and bustle of Honolulu this house is a definite contender. So much to see all within a 30 minute drive—even better, Lanikai and Kailua beaches are a 15 minute drive away. I would hands down stay here again next time I visit Oahu.

The House is more charming in person than in the pics. Blaine & Vai were very responsive and accommodating to all our concerns and request. The house is equipped with almost anything you would need for a comfortable stay. I will surely love to stay in their property again.

Tutu's Hale was a wonderful place to stay! I'm so glad that we stayed in Kailua for our first trip to Hawaii. Blane's rental was just as the pictures displayed and everything is high end from the fixtures to the linens. Having beach equipment to use was very handy and enabled us to hit the beach as soon as we got there. Several beaches are just a short drive and several stores are just 5 to 10 minutes away. Vai was great to work with and all of the recommendations were very helpful. If you get the chance, check out Morning Brew and Cactus where chef Thomas went above and beyond to make our dinner extra special!Everywhere we went people were so kind and generous. If we ever get the chance to make it back to Oahu, we will be staying here and we will be telling our friends about this little piece of paradise.

This house give us wonderful memory!!!
Not for location because it takes us little bit time to find it. But it is very quiet and safty. You can easily find supermarket and restaurant over there. You would have full tablewares to cook BBQ/ seafood even Chinese food. All of them are new and we love the dishwasher, it is huge and high efficiency. The house looks very new from inside, new towel new bed new washroom new kitchen. The house owener give us some gift(local food), we take them on our the way out.

They were very hospitable.  A welcome basket with various island goodies was left for us as we arrived.  The property manager was just a phone call away  in case we needed anything.  She was very willing to answer any questions that we had.
The home was so comfortable.  We felt right at home there.
The house was nice and spacious! It is perfect for family. The hosts were very friendly and responsive.

Great house and perfect place for family vacation! My family had a wonderful time, especially, enjoyed having the large dining table. Also, little gift basket from from Blaine and Vai was nice little touch :) Great location as well. It's quiet and not too far from all the places that we wanted to visit. I would definitely visit Tutu's Hale! Thank you Blaine and Vai again!

Tutu's Hale is a truly lovely home with all the expected amenities. The home resides in a lovely neighborhood just off the path enough that you become a local. It has been decorated with the culture of Hawaii and the history in pictures completes the atmosphere.  Tutu's has been updated with a state of the art kitchen and there is plenty of hot water, even when all 6 of us took showers. It is impeccably clean!  We would highly recommend this place! Thank you Blaine and Vai for your courtesy and assistance.  The Green's
Great home in a good neighborhood. The house was priced below the market, is well appointed and their local property manager was incredibly helpful.

It was very nice staying at Blaine's place!! He welcomed us with a nice basket full with Hawaiian surprises, we loved it! The neighborhood was lovely, we enjoyed Kailua city, nice restaurants and nice shops! The home was beautiful and relaxing, with a nice view of the surrounding and not far away from the busy Honolulu! I will definatly recommend Blaine's place to anyone visiting Oahu!

Vai, Blaine's property manager for the space, was incredibly welcoming and friendly. Although I didn't get to meet her in person, she was communicative and certainly made us feel at home. The home was beautiful and although the pictures are beautiful, it does not do the space justice.
The house is amazingly beautiful and spacious! The house was equipped with everything we needed for my family to enjoy our Hawaiian experience. We had a great experience and would stay there again!

It was such a wonderful place to stay. You would feel this place like your real home. The nice interiors makes the stay even more Hawaiian like.  Lovely host are so helpful and polite. House manager was such a warm and generous lady, too!!   Thank you so much for a great stay!

Fabulous.  Tutu's Hale with a View is a wonderful inviting home.  We had eight adults in the house and we did not feel crowded.  It was so easy working with Blaine and Vai - they were very responsive to any questions that we had.
Experience exceeded expectations! Perfect location, beautiful home and made my families stay stress free!

We had 6 adult and 2 little ones and the house was perfect for our family! Vei and Blaine were awesome thought the whole process.
Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable. Would definitely stay again!!

Elizabeth Naki

We had a wonderful time staying at the house. It's exactly what you'd expect from the pictures. The house was full of items you'll need to enjoy your stay and not worry too much of running to the nearest store. The location was also perfect. Quiet neighborhood and close enough to the beach at Kailua or Lanikai beach park. Our family would definitley stay at Blaine's property again when we come back to Oahu. Mahalo Blaine and Vai for keeping an open communication. It was also a pleasure meeting Norma too :)

Our stay at Tutu's Hale was fantastic.  The house was beautiful, clean with all up-to-date amenities.  Our host left us an assortment of Hawaiian treats to welcome us into their home, and we really hated having to leave when our time ended.

While the description does say that the house does not have AC, the tradewinds that supposedly cool down the house did not do their job during our stay. We were traveling with our two month old which required one of us to stay in the house most of the day and it was unbearably hot. It also made it impossible for us to swaddle our baby at night for fear of overheating. 
Overall, the condition of the house was nice except for the washer which smelled like mildew and the shower curtain liners which were dirty. 
It's hard to be positive about the house when we were so uncomfortable with the heat. If we weren't traveling with such a small child, we would have done better to escape the heat by staying outside of the house all day. I think the host should warn families with babies and small children - it seemed unreasonable to expect anyone to stay inside all day with no relief from the heat. We ended up having to purchase a portable AC for our bedroom. Our host suggested to rent one but we couldn't find a company that rented out small portable air conditioners. 
After reading the reviews, I had high expectations of this house. Also, since my correspondence with Blaine months before our visit was friendly and positive, I thought for sure that our stay would be great. Unfortunately, during our stay, I didn't find him to be as friendly or helpful. Vai, the property manager, was not available for most of our stay which was not explained to us until our attempts to contact her failed our first day there. 

My family loves Kailua and this neighborhood was really quiet and nice. I was really optimistic about this listing because it was reasonably priced for Kailua. Next time, I'll make sure to stay in a cooler and nicer place and make the drive if I want to go to Lanikai.

This property is amazing! It housed my whole family of 8 comfortably. The location was lovely. The beaches where pristine.

Vai and Blaine were sweet and patient and helped me through my whole credit card ordeal. The beach umbrella/cooler and chairs provided was just the right touch!

I would recommend this property to anyone! I live in the city so being only 20-30 min away from Honolulu was optimal. 

The trails and hikes are so close we made it an everyday morning activity!

I loved the house, and it topped my first expectation of airbnb. 
Ladies in my group were so pleased with spacious kitchen and all new appliances. I myself loved the backyard with awesome view.

It made my 20 years' wedding anniversary trip so memorable. I would definitely recommend this house to my friends.

BTW this house doesn't have AC, and rooms could be quite hot daytime.
But the air will be cooled down quickly as it has many doors and windows.

I miss the house already, and I would definitely revisit this place next time.

The host and the property manager responded quickly to all our communications.  The description of the house is accurate.  It was very clean,  beautifully decorated and the view from the back is great.  The neighborhood was safe and quiet.  It is not a resort neighborhood, but a residential neighborhood close to everything.

Our party of 8 had a wonderful time at Tutu's Hale with a View. The house  is a recent remodel which was exceptionally clean. Although the house got somewhat stuffy during the middle of the day, it was tolerable and its convenient location and safe neighborhood more than compensated.  

Our two toddlers especially liked finding lizards in the spacious backyard, 'swimming' in the bathtub, and patting the friendly neighborhood tabby cat.  We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Thank you Vai and Blaine for a wonderful stay.

Tutu's Hale was perfect for our girls' getaway. 

Great location, spacious and comfortable accommodations, breathtaking view, special personal touches with lots of Aloha spirit...the list goes on. 

Blaine and Vai were wonderful hosts. I'd definitely recommend and hope to return for a future trip.

Blaine and his Team made us feel like one if the family.  Easy to reach and help trouble shoot in the middle of his day when wi-fi when it went down, who does that??  If there is only 2 of you, pick Grandmas room.  So comfortable that we found ourselves wanting to stay in bed, but thanks to the amzing view of Kailua bekoning us to join her, we liesurely enjoyed fresh brewed coffee in the outside garden while chatting with the nieghbors before departing for downtown and the beach.  Tutu's Hale made it easy to forget that we do not actually live in Kailua.  I cannot imagine a better place to stay in Kailua, and if there is it must be Blaine's place #2.  The toiletries beat out any hotel selection.  My wife and I loved the shampoo& conditioner picks.  The gift basket was a nice touch and having an ice maker you do not have to take an elevator to get to was great.  Live the Kailua lifestyle, stay at Tutu's Place!

My friends and I were in Kailua for a wedding and this was the closest place to our bride who was staying on right on the beach. The house is even better than the pictures and much cuter in person. The kitchen and house are renovated nicely and it's perfectly decorated. The house is fully stocked with dish ware, pots and pans, towels and even snorkeling gear! It's a quaint neighborhood and within a five minute drive to Safeway. It does get a bit muggy in the rooms, but it's nicer if you open the windows and doors. It was a great stay. I highly recommend it!

There was a little mix up upon entry with the cleaning crew so we were delayed about an hour and a half but Vai was more than apologetic and we were still able to swing by and drop our luggage off. Upon arrival and getting situated the beautiful home and view totally made up for the minor hiccup. I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful view! The home itself is also emmaculate - the kitchen has more than enough for all your cooking needs. Once we opened up the windows and got the fans going the home cooled off pretty quickly. The wifi wasn't working during our stay but that didn't bother us, who comes to Hawaii to sit at home and play on wifi?! Not us that's for sure! Lots of great beaches, places to eat, and hiking. Can't wait to come back! Mahalo Blaine and Vai for your amazing hospitality!

This place is everything described and more. It has more than you could possibly need, from a rice cooker to beach toys for the kids. Beds are great, every appliance is available and efficiant and a special touch of family photos and memories through your the home. What a beautiful modern home in a great location, we will be back and stay here again!

When looking for a place to stay for our family, Blaine's family home stood out far above any other I had seen.  The home was lovely and priced well.  Everything was comfortable and there were many special touches that showed the Hawaiian hospitality.  The beforehand communication was great and the follow up was amazing as well, the desire to make sure our stay was everything we hoped for was evident.  I am extremely happy with our stay and our whole family enjoyed this beautiful home, I know I made an excellent choice.  thank you Blaine and Vai, we appreciate you!
Blaine and Vai were wonderful communicators and the space was perfect - exactly how it looks. We couldn't have enjoyed it more!!

My family (me and husband, brother, and my parents) were in Hawai'i for my grandfather's funeral as well as the 75th anniversary of the Pearl Harbor bombing. This house gave us a comfortable place to stay as a family with plenty of room and lots of great amenities. With the house close to grocery shopping and a cook's kitchen (great pots and pans, gas stove), we were able to have many dinners at "home". Being that we were there for my grandfather, it was especially comforting being in your grandmother's home. The beds were comfortable, the view was beautiful, and the drive to the Honolulu side of the island is really not that far. It was a bit rainy while we were there, and the tradewinds weren't blowing much. It made evenings a little warm, but the bedrooms have ceiling fans, so that made up for it. 

Thank you so much for being great hosts, and providing such a gorgeous place to stay. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

This home was very spacious. We were a family of 8 when we had rented this home. Pictures dont do justice to this beautiful home.  It had a backyard where my children played, a bbq grill to cook in so that we didnt have to eat out often, a gorgeous kitchen, a table that can fit 8, & a great breeze that made the entire home cool. There were no AC units but the breeze & ceiling fans made it nice & comfortable. I must say that this home is in spectacular condition & very clean. Bathrooms had all the amenities as well. 

You would need to rent a car if you would like to rent this home. We explored the famous beaches nearby, hiked at pillbox & was able to witness President Obama play golf at the 18th hole. There are many restaurants, little boutiques, starbucks, target, & wholefoods (my happy place) at your convenience. 

This is a place to get away from the tourist area. And if you decide to drive in town.. It is only less than a 30 minute drive. 

Our host, Blaine & our property manager, Vai was always quick to respond if there were any questions. We had all the privacy we needed. 

This was a wonderful experience. I would definitely recommend this home.
Wonderful stay! 5 stars!

The place is fantastic and Kailua is magical. We stayed here for four weeks and couldn't have had a better time. We have a 2.5 year old son and the neighborhood was perfect for playing (cul-de-sac) and it was also very quiet at night helping him (and us) get plenty of sleep. I would recommend this place to my closest friends and family for sure. If you are on the fence, book it!  You won't be disappointed.

Mahalo Cousin Blaine for sharing Tutu's Hale with our Ohana for our family vacation. We were so impressed with the space, ammenities, and serene view from the top! Quiet mornings out in the backyard to start our days and after a busy day of local adventures, we'd come back to such a peaceful oasis! Was really cool too, the app options on the TV, making it convenient to chill out and watch our favorite flicks after a long day! Even with a house packed full, the layout gave us all plenty of space to enjoy ourselves, not feeling like we were on top of each other. Tutu's is beautiful, my favorite part; getting to smell the Pikake flowers every morning in the front yard before starting my day! Location is perfect, not being far from every day conveniences (I.e. grocery, restaurants, etc.) and even fun local spots (The Shack, Kailua Beach, Zippys!). Our trip was absolutely wonderful and Tutu's Hale made us feel right at home. Mahalo again cousin.
This is a good place to stay in O'ahu island, if you want to avoid tourist crowd in Honolulu.

We had a wonderful & relaxing stay at Tutu's house. Vai & Blaine were great hostesses & always communicated  promptly. House was very comfortable, clean and well stocked. The gift basket was a really nice touch. Store, restaurants & beach are a short drive away.  House was spacious & was perfect to share with another family.
Everything was nice!!

We are a family with 3 young children (ages 6, 5 and 2) and Tutu's Hale was an amazing place to stay on Oahu.  We have stayed in Kailua before and when we first booked Tutu's Hale, we were a little worried that it was far from the beach, but in fact the trip is very short to both Lanikai and Kailua beaches and I couldn't have been more happy with our choice.
The house has everything you need to feel like you're at home and Vai was always available when we had any questions.
It is spacious and comfortable with a well-stocked kitchen.   There is even a coffee bean grinder for those who want to know whether to purchase ground coffee or beans.  There is even a libations cabinet for those who can get through the child safety lock (which we eventually figured out).
There are beach toys, boogie boards, snorkels, coolers, beach mats and lawn chairs.  Everything you need for an awesome beach day!
The only recommendation I have is that if you have a child who is 3 and under, I would consider bringing your pak n' play for bedtime.  The beds at the house are big and comfortable, but pretty high off the ground.
We loved the photos of Tutu and her 'Ohana around the house.  You really get the sense that you've been welcomed into this beautiful home.
Thank you for sharing your home with us!

Blaine's place is cozy with a great open kitchen for you and your family/friends to eat in after a day full of activities. It's located in a quiet, residential area but still close (walking distance) to restaurants and the local supermarket, has 2 very clean bathrooms and the best part is, you can do your laundry right away after a day at the beach. 

Thank you for being a great host.

Our families had a wonderful stay at Tutu's Hale! It was in a quiet, residential area which was nice at night since we slept with the windows open. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you could possibly need and the house even comes with a sonos sound system ready to go.

Vai was super nice and made sure to check in on us halfway through our stay. The welcome basket was also a nice touch since we devoured the treats upon arrival. The yard is very well kept and has a a great view of Kailua. 

It is a short drive to Kailua and Lanikai beaches and  parking was generally easy to find. We used all of the beach stuff at the house which was a nice bonus.

The only slight downside is that there is no a/c but with all of the fans, it was completely fine. 

Would definitely stay here again and really enjoyed our time here!!
Excellent house, location and host. We would book it again! It made our holiday on Oahu very special. Thanks!

Tutu's Hale is the perfect extension of our own home for extended family visiting from the mainland.  We LOVED not having to trek back and forth from downtown to spend time with each other.  The big kitchen is a huge bonus.  We will use this home again for future gatherings.  Mahalo, Blaine and Vai!

We loved Blaine's house! Communication with the property manager, Vai, was great!  The little welcome basket was a nice touch especially after our long travel from the East Coast.  The house was super clean and slept all 8 of us quite comfortably.  The drive from the airport to the house was one of the highlights of our trip and was a great way to start things off (awesome views)!

We loved the local beach.  It was breathtaking and less busy than the beaches closer to the city.  The house is also very close to the pillbox hiking trail which we did twice.  We enjoyed the local restaurants in Kailua and found getting around to be easy.  We visited much of the island from Blaine's place and could reach all of our destination in under an hour.  Being from the East Coast, we often awoke early and sat in chairs in the back yard as the sun came up.  Watch out for the local kitty (I called Vincent since he was missing an ear) who likes to go behinds cars when it is dark.

The only nit picks (and they really are nit picks) is that the water pressure in one shower was a bit low and an army of slugs liked to appear in the back yard late at night and in the early morning (OK by me but the girls didn't like it!).  A boat parked opposite the drive way makes backing out a little tricky.

But the positives of this house vastly outway those little issues.  If we can return, we would absolutely stay here again!  Highly recommended!  

Thanks Blaine and Vai!
Nice place with new furniture and good location
Lovely house, brillant kitche ans lovely host

This is a beautiful property.  The location was perfect and the house is really a home away from home.  My family and I were in Kailua for my son's wedding and this home was perfect for our needs.   Hosts Vai and Blaine were very responsive and most accommodating.  I highly recommend Tutu's Hideaway for a beautiful & relaxing island getaway.
What a great place - everything as advertised, and more! HIGHLY recommended. Great location, great views, and extremely well kept and maintained. A nice quiet neighborhood.

A lovely home with tasteful decorations in a convenience location if you are interested in spending time at the beaches.  Two great beaches within 5 mins driving are Kailua state beach and Lanaikai beach.  We spent most of our time at these two beaches for 9 days vacation.  The picture matches the house exactly.  The kitchen was  fully stocked with every condiments to make a multi-nationals dishes.  A good steak  or an Asian dish.  Well made pots and pans and a great collection of cooking books to help us created many great dishes. A good collection of travel guides books in the house were very helpful for our trip.  We found many other hidden beaches in NorthShore by reading through some of these books which we explored. The neighborhood was quiet, the house has a big back yard for the kids to play and a beautify city view.   
Vai, the host was responsive to our needs and not very intrusive.  She was always attentive from the time we arrived to the tine we left.  
Thanks Vai for creating a great Hawaiian experience for us, we will definitely stay at your home again the next time we visit Oahu.

This was an amazing place, central to everything you may need! It had spectacular views of Kailua! It is very close to the best beaches on the island.
They left us snacks, which was wonderful to arrive to after a long flight!! The owners are very friendly and communicative.Only has fans, no central AC (as is common with Hawaaiin homes, we noticed. Family of 8 fit comfortably! Highly recommend and would definitely stay here again!
Great place for family. Would stay again.

If you want a great place to stay away from the city  Tutu's place is the best 
The house is gorgeous, very comfortable especially for 8 people.  Very close to one of the most beautiful beach on the island.   We enjoyed this place and can't wait to return 
Aloha & Mahalo
